He wants to buy more cattle for developing the business, but he has not money for it. He is asking for a loan of 4000 somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José originario de Estelí, tiene 55 años, padre de 4 hijos entre las edades de 18, 22,25 y 30 años de edad, de oficio comerciante. El comenzó a trabajar primeramente vendiendo plástico, con capital propio, pero luego aprendió a empacar especies tales como canela, manzanilla, pimienta, romero, eucalipto, a la edad de 37 años, ya que miro que  este negocio le genera bastante ingreso, de esta manera el  empezó a distribuir sus productos en las comunidades mas cercana como en Palacaguina, Sauce, Limay  y  Condega. El quiere surtir su negocio para ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. 
Por este motivo solicita un crédito para comprar utensilios plásticos, bolsas y una engrapadora industrial. Ya que el estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda porque asi el podrá comprar mas productos e incrementar sus ganancias en su negocio, además tendrá la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes. Sus expectativas es crecer económicamente y seguir distribuyendo sus productos en todo los supermercado,  y sus planes futuro es mejorar s vivienda y  poder comprar un medio de transporte para ir a distribuir sus productos  en toda Nicaragua.
texts.en:
José a native of Estelí, is 55 years old, a father of 4 children aged: 18, 22, 25 and 30, and is a retailer.  He first started working selling plastic with his own capital, but then he learned how to pack spices such as cinnamon, chamomile, pepper, rosemary, and eucalyptus. At the age of 37, once he realized that this business was generating a lot of income, he began to distribute his products in neighboring communities like Palacaguina, Sauce, Limay and Condega.  

He wants to stock his store in order to offer more products to his clients.  For this reason, he is asking for this loan in order to purchase 
plastic utensils, bags and an industrial stapler.  He believes that this loan will be of great help because with it he will be able to purchase more products and increase his business's earnings.  In addition, he will a have the opportunity to expand his business and offer his clients more products.  His expectations are to grow financially and continue distributing his products in all of the supermarkets.  His future plans are to better his life and be able to purchase a mode of transportation to be able to distribute his products all over Nicaragua.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils, bags and an industrial stapler.

loans.name: Amanecer Anteña Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jovita ella es separada y tiene 49 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y azúcar para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de panadería, venta de moraya, venta de chicha, tienda de abarrotes, venta de leche, venta de fruta, agricultura, cafetería, venta de desayunos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the group “AMANECER ANTEÑA.” This group is located in the Anta district, in the province of Anta in the Cusco district.

Jovita is separated and is 49 years old with 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the grocery store business. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, sweets, and sodas. She has spent years in this business which is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily. She works in her business Monday to Sunday from approximately 6:00am to 9:00pm, although this schedule may vary according to her daily activities. She is a responsible and diligent person, being this way she moves her family forward.

She requests this loan to buy goods like rice and sugar for her business.

The other partners are involved with a bakery, the sale of moraya (potato product), the sale of chicha (beverage), a grocery store, the sale of milk, the sale of fruit, agriculture, a cafe, and the sale of breakfast.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through Kiva and is committed to complying with the payment of their dues within the established terms.

loans.use: to buy goods like rice and sugar for their business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a very focused woman who has all the skills an entrepreneur should possess. She has been operating a food vending business for a long time. Recently, she decided to open a new business: selling vegetables from her home. She has a small stall outside her compound. She is thankful for the location of her home, which is along the busy streets leading to the trading center. Mariam is requesting this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. This way she will be sure to provide what her customers want.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 5 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta y de esa forma se ayudan y pueden afrontar cualquier problema que tengan.
Una historia es la de la Sr. Tomasa quien se dedica a la venta de  chipa, gallina , huevo y comida esto gracias a la ayuda de la fundación y de su grupo con los créditos que se le otorgó , nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Solicita del préstamo para la compra de huevos, y de insumos para sus comidas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
San Cayetano Communal Bank is already on its 5th cycle due to their hard work, unity, and mutual support in the programme. As well as each person's individual work, they also develop activities together and in this way help each other and can confront any problem they have. 

One of their stories is that of Tomasa who sells cheesy buns, chicken, eggs and meals thanks to the foundation's help and the loans that have been granted to her through the group. She comments that because of the loan she was able to improve her business, standard of living and economic income. 

She is requesting the loan in order to buy eggs and ingredients for her meals, as in this way she will be able to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs and other food ingredients etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one Dell computer and movie tapes for his video library.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy dresses to sell at her business.

loans.name: Welser José

texts.es:
El Señor  Welser José trabaja para una institución pública del estado en el municipio de La paz centro desde hace 7 años como responsable de caja, es casado tiene dos hijos,  con dicha actividad laboral que desempeña es con la que ha sacado adelante su familia brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas del hogar.

Actualmente es su segundo crédito que tiene con nuestra institución y lo requiere para mejorar la casa de habitación realizando cambio de techo (compra de zinc y perlines) para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Welser José has worked as a cashier for a state public institution in the municipality of La Paz center for seven years. He is married and has two children. With his job, he has gotten his family ahead, providing them with education, food and basic home necessities.

Currently, this is his second loan with our institution, and he needs it to improve their house by replacing the roof (buying zinc and purlins) to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks and cement.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangelisto

texts.es:
Evangelisto de oficio agricultor, tiene  la edad de54 años de edad, padre de 4 hijos, casado, se dedica a la siembra  de granos básicos maíz, arroz, frijoles. Es un cliente Kiva. Evangelisto  muestra su agradecimiento a Kiva y MiCrédito por el apoyo brindado con el préstamo otorgado, ya que trajo mucho cambios positivos en su  vida  y negocio pudo invertir en la siembra obteniendo mejor rendimiento y calidad en productos, de esta manera incrementaron las ventas.
El solicita el préstamo para pagar de mano de obra y comprar mas insumo para el mantenimiento de sus siembras de maíz, frijoles y sorgo. Esto le ayudara a darle una mejor asistencia a sus siembras y así obtener una producción de calidad y buenos rendimientos.
texts.en:
Evangelisto is a farmer. He is 54 years old, married, and the father of four children. He earns his living growing staple crops like corn, rice, and beans. 

Evangelisto is a Kiva borrower. He expresses his gratitude to Kiva and MiCrédito for the support provided with the loan that was granted, since it brought many positive changes to his life and his business. He was able to invest in his crops, resulting in a better yield and better product quality, thereby increasing his sales.

He is requesting this loan to pay for labor and to buy more supplies for the maintenance of his corn, bean, and sorghum crops. This will help him to take better care of his plantings, producing a high-quality crop with better yields.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy more supplies for the maintenance of his corn, bean, and sorghum crops.

loans.name: Lideres Emprendedores Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LIDERES EMPRENDEDORES está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas  mujeres,    la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Maria tiene 29 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de un año,  ella se dedica al servicio de peinados y de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de productos de peluquería y belleza, como tintes de cabello y ruleros, también variedad de cremas y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su salón de belleza, la Sra. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso ses la única actividad que les permite mantener a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Lideres Emprendedores" [Enterprising Leaders] is composed of eight members, all of them women. The president of the bank is María, who is 29 years old and has a one-year-old little boy. She earns her living doing hairstyling, manicures, and makeup in a beauty salon located in the El Torno neighborhood of the city of Santa Cruz. 

This loan is María's first cycle within the institution. She is going to use this loan to purchase hairstyling and beauty products, like hair color and rollers as well as a variety of creams. She is going to use the proceeds to continue buying materials and improving her beauty salon. 

María is a very hardworking person, and she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her and her fellow members. In many cases, their work is the only source of support for their families.

loans.use: to buy hairstyling and beauty products.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, solicita un préstamo, para poder invertir en la compra de medicina, adquiriendo variedad en tabletas, inyecciones, sueros, esta nueva inversión le permitirá ofrecer a los clientes lo que se ajuste a sus necesidades.
Considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió tener lo necesario para realizar su trabajo, mejorando su capacidad y las ventas, ha logrado tener ingresos constantes.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of medicines. He will acquire a variety of tablets, injections, and serums. This new investment will enable him to offer products to his customers that are suited to their needs.

José says that his previous loan enabled him to have what he needed to do his job. As a result, he was able to improve his capacity and his sales, as well as achieve a constant revenue stream.

loans.use: to buy tablets, injections, and serums.

loans.name: 7 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El comité “7 de agosto” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, son 13 mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras. Todas ellas son mujeres de campo, que pese a su escaso recurso quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cabras, vacas y demás, y por medio de esto ayudan a sus familias.
Fabiola, una de las miembros, solicita el crédito para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales y también distintos granos.
texts.en:
The "7 de agosto" ["August 7"] committee was formed by several neighboring women in the city of Santaní.  They are 13 very hard-working and, above all, entrepreneurial women. They are all rural woman who, despite their scarce resources, want to get ahead and help their families.  All the members make their living by raising and selling farm animals such as chickens, goats, cows, and more. This is how they help their families.  

Fabiola, one of the members, is applying for a loan in order to buy animal feed as well as various grains.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy the necessary basic ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger, vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja como Auxiliar Contable en una Institución, el nivel de educación es secundario, ocupa una habitación que está en un acabado de ladrillo, la casa está ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de la Paz.

Roger, percibe un sueldo básico donde trabaja ocho horas al día para ayudarse con sus estudios y ayudar en algunos gastos de servicios básicos a sus padres.

El crédito que solicita es para el pago de matricula de sus estudios de Contabilidad que actualmente realiza que se relaciona con su actividad y además en un futuro le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Roger es crecer como profesional y así mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida con su familia.

Es la quinta vez con IMPRO  y la segunda con KIVA, que tiene los créditos, y está muy satisfecho con el crédito.
texts.en:
Roger’s lives at his parents’ house, which is made of brick. He works as an assistant bookkeeper for an institution. Roger has a high school education. His home is located in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Roger receives a basic salary for working eight hours a day. This helps to pay for his studies and to cover a few basic services for his parents.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for his registration fees for his accounting studies, since these courses are related to his job. In addition, he hopes a degree will help to improve his income in the future.

Roger’s dream is to grow as a professional and increase his earnings so that he can improve his family’s quality of life. This is the fifth time he has worked with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva. He has been very satisfied with the loans.

loans.use: to pay for his registration fees so that he can continue his accounting studies.

loans.name: Mercedes Antonia

texts.es:
Mercedes, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, se comprara cerdos para engordarlos, específicamente serán 6 y con este número podrá tener una mejor inversión y crecimiento en la granja.
El préstamo anterior le permitió tener más capacidad, aumentando su granja, en su familia considera que sus circunstancias económicas han sido estables, viviendo en una buena condición.
texts.en:
Mercedes is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest more into her business. She will buy pigs for fattening, six to be exact, since this number will result in the best investment and spur growth in her farm.

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her capacity and grow her farm. Mercedes says that her family’s financial circumstances have become stable and that they live in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy six pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto Hurtado Narvaez

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 43 años de edad, originario de Teustepe, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 4 y 17, el cual tiene a cargo 3 personas en su vivienda, actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, como es la siembra de maíz y trigo además de este negocio tiene otro como es la crianza de cerdos, del que es propietario hace 6 años, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, el vende sus productos  en la misma comarca donde habita.
 Don Cesar esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de unos tubos y abonos para la siembra de maíz y trigo para la siguiente cosecha, este crédito le ayudara a mejorar mas rápido la siembra y la crianza de sus cerdos y asi obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio, y sus planes futuro es cancela  dicho préstamo y con las ganancias que obtenga  comprar unos terneros ya que sus  metas es hacer crecer su negocio y asi poder obtener mas productos agrícolas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Cesar is 43 years old, originally from Teustepe, married and father of two children between the ages of 4 and 17, he has three people who live with him and he currently works in agriculture, planting of corn and wheat, but aside from this job, he has another raising pigs, a business that he has owned for 6 years and now that he has the help of his wife, he sells his products in the same region where he lives. Mr. Cesar is applying for a loan to purchase tubes and fertilizer for his corn and wheat harvest so he can plant more corn and wheat for next season's harvest, this loan will help him to improve his harvest more quickly and the raising of his pigs as well, and so he will get better returns from his business. His plans for the future are to pay off this loan and with the earnings be able to purchase some calves because his goal is to grow his business so that he can have more agricultural products to offer his clients.

loans.use: purchase tubes and fertilizers for his corn and wheat harvest.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 49 años de edad, originaria de la comarca el caracol Teustepe, casada, tiene 4 hijos, pero actualmente tiene 1 hijo a cargo de 4 años de edad. Ella cuenta  que comenzó su pulpería con dinero que le mando su esposo de Costa Rica y con un crédito que obtuvo de otras instituciones. La cual tiene 3 años de tenerla, ya que este ha sido su primer negocio del cual sobrevive a diario y recibe otros ingresos como son las remesas que le envía su esposo ya que sus objetivos son hacer crecer su negocio para incrementar las ganancias.
Paula solicita el préstamo  para comprar granos básicos como arroz,  frijoles, azúcar y aceite. Ya que ella estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda para hacer crecer económicamente su negocio y poder comprar los productos de mayor demanda que buscan los clientes, asi aumentar sus ingresos y poder ampliar su negocio, ya que sus planes futuros es pagar su primer  crédito y después poder solicitar otro crédito para invertir mas en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Paula is 49 years old, originally from Teustepe, married, and has four children, but currently only has one child who is four years old to take care of. She tells us that she started her grocery store with money that her husband sent from Costa Rica and with a loan that she obtained through other institutions. She has had her store for 3 years, and this has been her primary business from which she survives day by day but she gets other forms of income from the remittances that her husband sends because her objective is to grow her business so she can have higher returns.
Paula is asking for a loan to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar and oil. She thinks that this loan will be a great help to her to help her economically grow her business and to be able to purchase products that are in greater demand and that her clients look for, she will be able to increase her earnings and expand her business. Her future plans are to pay her first loan and afterwards apply for a second loan to invest more in her grocery store.

loans.use: purchase basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos: Roy, Adhy y Nena a quienes dedica todo su amor. Posee una vivienda hecha a base de madera que adquirió sola. Ella se dedica al mantenimiento de productos agrícolas dentro de las cuales esta el cacao, siendo su espacio de trabajo, una parcela que le heredaros sus familiares. Asimismo, este trabajo requiere de mucha mano de obra, por ello contrata jornaleros cada vez que sea necesario, en especial la temporada de cosecha, por ser actividades netamente forzosas.
Considera que su trabajo es uno de los más abnegados y a la vez reconfortantes ya que el buen resultado de sus cosechas es bien cotizado por los acopiadores de la zona, no obstante lo que intenta desmotivarla son algunas plagas que se apoderan sus plantaciones arruinando de manera considerable su producción final.
Ahora inicia otro ciclo de producción en donde ella se prepara con todo lo necesario para desempeñar su trabajo de manera fluida, por ello será necesario comprar plantas de almácigo, injertos de cacao y sacos de abono orgánico. Adicional a ello es necesario reservar capital suficiente para la contrata de jornaleros con el objetivo de aligerar las distintas tareas agrícolas. 
Día a día se levanta muy temprano con el objetivo de lograr a futuro la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad y construir una vivienda para el futuro bienestar de sus hijos. Tiene consigo siete préstamos con MFP,  y esta vez solicita 2,000 para la compra de plantas de almácigo, injertos de cacao, sacos de abono orgánico y parte del dinero lo reservará la contrata de jornaleros.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, she is a single mother and has three children: Roy, Adhy and Nena all of whom she loves very much. She has a home made of wood that she purchased all on her own. She works at maintaining agricultural products like cacao and her work site is a parcel of land that she inherited from family members. On its own, this work requires a lot of physical labor, to do the work she hires day laborers whenever she needs to, especially during the harvest season for the truly necessary jobs. 
She considers her work one of the most humble ones and at the same time comforting since the results of the harvest are highly sought after by middle men in her area, nevertheless what has been trying to sap her motivation recently are a few plagues that take over her land and ruin a significant portion of her final product.
She is now starting a new production cycle where she prepares all that is necessary to carry out her job in a fluid way, and to do it she will need to purchase Copperwood plants, grafts from cacao trees and sacks of organic fertilizer. In addition to this, she will need to reserve enough capital to hire day laborers to try to lighten the load of the distinct agricultural jobs. 
Day to day she gets up very early with the objective of achieving a future land purchase in the city and to build a house for the comfort of her children. She has seven loans with MFP and this time she is asking for $775 to purchase Copperwood plants, grafts from cacao trees and sacks of organic fertilizer and part of the money will be used to hire day laborers.

loans.use: purchase copperwood plants, grafts from a cacao plant, sacks of organic fertilizer and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Priscille

texts.en:
Priscille is 45 years old. She has been a maize farmer for 20 years. She wants the loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor to upgrade her farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Aldea Cunda Group

texts.es: Gonzalo es miembro del Grupo Solidario Aldea Cunda, tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y es casado, el señor Gonzalo inicio desde hace algunos años con una pequeña pulpería la cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo, el horario de atención es de 7:00 am a 8:00 pm tiene el apoyo de su esposa que es la que le ayuda atender la pulpería. Una de las dificultades que ha Gonzalo se le presenta es que tiene que ir a comprar su producto al pueblo por lo que tiene que pagar transporte para trasladar su mercadería. El préstamo que Gonzalo esta solicitando lo necesita para surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería y lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, manteca, frijoles, jabón, detergente, productos lácteos, refrescos, churros, dulces, etc. El espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ingresos aumenten y así poder cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual. Su sueño es mejorar su pulpería y que sea una de las más surtidas de la zona. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera poder cumplir con sus compromisos de pago de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a member of the solidarity group “Aldea Cunda”. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Sr. Gonzalo started a small convenience store a few years ago and it has grown gradually since then. His hours of operation are from 7:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. His wife helps with managing the store. One of Gonzalo’s challenges is having to go into town to buy his products and transporting them back to his shop.

The loan Gonzalo is requesting will be used to restock his business with new merchandise. He will invest in the purchase of products such as rice, lard, beans, soap, detergent, dairy goods, soft drinks, snack foods, candies, and other items. He hopes that the support of this loan will enable him to increase his income and to submit his loan payments on time.

His dream is to improve his convenience store so that it becomes one of the best-stocked shops in the area. This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he hopes to complete his payment commitments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, lard, beans, soap, detergent, dairy goods, soft drinks, snack foods, candies, and other items.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Anifa is one of the few women in her area who has shown great enterprising skills. She does not want to fully depend on her spouse for everything. This is why she wants to always be in business to cover her small expenses and help her husband to cater for the family expenses. She is grateful for the previous loan that had a great positive impact on her living standards. She asking for a new loan to make a new investment that will enable her to buy more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbages, bananas, oranges, etc.
Her aim is to continue to be in business and have a better and presentable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbages, bananas, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 52 years old.  He is married to a farmer and they have five children.  He has spent 30 years in farming.  He would like to receive a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production.  He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes used the previous loan to buy used shoes to sell.  She is a hardworking, young woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She used to sell for someone else but then started her own business using the savings she made while working.  The challenges she faces include price fluctuation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to buy more stock.  Her personal goal is to build a permanent home.  Her business goals are to move her business to a more permanent location and to expand into new markets.  Agnes intends to use the loan facility to buy more shoes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Lafia sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires avec en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Darsalam dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine Ségou. Elles font l’achat et la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine, jus locaux, pagnes brodés, wax, foulards et d’habits et  de la friperie. Dans le souci de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 10ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Mariam (la seule femme assise sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits et de friperie de qualité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux balles de la friperie. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte à domicile, en ambulant  et au marché de Médine. Avec ce prêt, Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge la scolarisation des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women in the Lafia group are married and for the most part in nuclear families. They are 35 years old on average and have an average of four children each. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of the city of Ségou and know each other from their businesses in the Médine Ségou marketplace. They buy and sell kitchenware, local juices, embroidered fabrics, wax, scarves, and secondhand clothing. In order to increase their capital, the members of the group are on their 10th group loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

Mariam, (the woman seated in the photo,) is a great seller of quality new and secondhand clothing. She will use her loan to buy two bales of secondhand clothing. She sells her retail goods for cash and credit to a mixed clientele out of her home, while traveling, and at the Médine Ségou marketplace. 

With this loan, Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to support the education of the children in her household.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a 52-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a hardworking man involved in a number of ventures, which include a retail shop, a dairy  and farming. His business is located in a market, thus attracting many customers. Like most responsible fathers, he wishes to educate his children to attain university degrees. His business dreams are to expand to new markets and own a wholesale shop, despite the challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. Augustine is requesting a loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy  sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Assinatha

texts.en: Assinatha is a mother of three children. Assinatha is 60 years old. She has been a maize farmer for the past 40 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production. With the profits from the business, she plans to buy a small tractor to help with the farming. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima lives with her family. She is a very enterprising woman who, in spite of difficulties, has always been known for doing her best for her family, who have never wanted for anything. She is an enterprising woman and a role model for a large number of mothers. Halima currently sells firewood from her home, which enables her to earn an honest living and to continually safeguard her family's future. Halima wants to expand her business further and, therefore, she has decided to apply to Yehu for a loan which will allow her to buy more firewood to sell. This is her first loan cycle, and she is sure to repay the loan as scheduled so as to remain trustworthy and be able to be entrusted with more loans in future.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: San Isidro De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karin ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría pollos, cuyes y patos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados y ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos, cuyes y patos y alimentos para los animales.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de chicha y negocio de venta de cuyes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank, located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member, Karin, 37, lives with her partner and has four children.  She works in her business raising animals: chickens, guinea pigs, and ducks.  She fattens them and makes them grow, then sells them in various markets and fairs.  She works from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m.  She has been in this business for six years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a place to sell her animals.

She's requesting a loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, ducks, and animal feed.

The other members' businesses are raising animals, a grocery store, selling "chicha" [a corn beverage], and selling guinea pigs.

She's grateful to those who, through this loan, are part of her dream, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, ducks, and animal feed

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba lives together with her husband, who is a driver, and 2 children at Nkrontrodo near Elmina.  She is a fish monger who buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it before reselling it.  She has been doing this for 5 years. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children.  Araba will use her loan to purchase fresh  fish to smoke and then sell.  She plans to reinvest her earnings for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and then sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is 41 years old.  She works as a cleaning woman in the hospital.  She is a widow with 2 children to support.  Jamila lives with her children in a house that was built, with great dedication, by her father.  Her house is old and in need of some repair.  She is first looking to purchase building material to fence her house.  As her salary is small, she is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy the material.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fencing for her home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 52-year-old married woman from Nocnocan, Talibon. She has operated a auto-repair shop together with her husband for more than twenty years now. They repair automobile failures and the like.
Teresita is asking for a loan to buy materials for mechanical services such as screw drivers, nuts and bolts and others. Through this, they will be able to cater to more customers, thus augmenting their daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy materials for mechanical services such as screw drivers, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Víctor Giovanny

texts.es:
Victor, Actualmente administra un pequeño negocio de Lubricantes, quiere mejorarlo y aumentar las ganancias a través de una nueva inversión, se comprara toda clase de lubricantes para vehículos y motocicletas, con esto estará mejorando su atención a los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior realizo una compra de medio de transporte, aun trabaja en la gasolinera, donde tiene su venta, sus ingresos le han sido mas altos, este negocio se mantiene en constante movimiento.
texts.en:
Victor is now running a small lubricants business. He wants to improve his business and increase his profits by investing in all types of lubricants for vehicles and motorcycles. This way he will be able to offer better customer service.
With the previous loan he received, he bought a vehicle to get to work. He still works at the gas station which is where he is selling from. This new venture has increased his income as he gets constant business.

loans.use: to buy lubricants to sell.

loans.name: Iwa Richard

texts.en:
Iwa is a 37-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 12. Three of them go to school. Iwa runs a general store, and has been in business for 6 years. He has one employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking out a loan of 6,000 SDG to purchase more lotions, milk, sugar, and other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.
In 5 years, Iwa would like to expand his business and open other branches.
His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.
Iwa says he is happy for the loans given to him by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotions, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Attia

texts.en: Ms Attia is a 32-year-old married woman. Five years ago, Attia started her own grocery store. She was under much stress at that time so she decided to open a retail shop in a small corner of her home as her husband’s daily income was not reliable and was insufficient to meet increasing expenses of the home with the increase in the inflation rate of the country. Gradually, she has improved her business and has a reliable source of income to lead a decent life by paying her utility bills on time. To cope with the increasing demands of her regular customers, she needs to make her store fully stocked with daily use goods. For this, she applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase stocks of sugar and more packs of salt and beverages. She aspires to save money to send her children to school for their better and prosperous future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and more packs of salt and beverages.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from the village of Norio, Abasha district. She is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children (23 and 26 years old). Her son works as a manager at the techniques store locally and her husband is an artisan. Both family members get a monthly salary.

Lali is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, she runs a small dairy business with four milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products.  She sells on average 40 kg. of cheese per month. In addition, the family grows maize on the family-owned land. The harvested maize is used for family needs. Besides, Lali has a pig and five piglets. She works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions for her family.

Lali requested the loan to purchase an additional milk cow. After the number of cattle is increased, the family will receive more milk for dairy products. This will increase the sales and a monthly income as well. With the increased income, Lali will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jessica Massiel

texts.es:
La Señora Jessica Massiel trabaja para una escuela pública del estado en el municipio de La paz centro desde hace 12 años como maestra de niños de 10 – 12 años, es casada tiene dos hijos,  con dicha actividad laboral que desempeña es con la que ha sacado adelante su familia brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas del hogar.

Actualmente es su segundo crédito que solicita a ceprodel y lo requiere para mejora de vivienda para comenzar a construir una pared y cambiar el piso de la casa dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica Massiel works at a public school owned by the state in the central section of the town of La Paz. She has been a teacher for 12 years and her students are between the ages of 10-12 years. Jessica is married and has two children. She says that the line of work she has pursued has enabled her family to move forward. Jessica has been able to provide education, food, and basic household necessities.

She is currently requesting her second loan from CEPRODEL. Jessica needs to make improvements to her home, which includes building a wall and replacing the floor in her house. This will result in better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and other construction supplies so that she can build a wall and replace the floors in her home.

loans.name: Lesbia  Justina

texts.es:
Lesbia tiene 39 años de edad, originaria de la comunidad de la concha Teustepe, soltera, madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 1 y13 años de edad respectivamente. Ella cuenta que viajo a Costa Rica a trabajar  por 6 años, y con lo que gano  decidió ahorrar  y poner  su negocio de pulpería, de esta manera pudo  comprar  su casa.
Actualmente se dedica a su pulpería de la que es propietaria hace 5 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor y le ayuda a comprar algunos productos de materia prima que necesita en su negocio. Hoy en día ella esta satisfecha con las ganancias que le genera su negocio. Asi poder ampliar  su negocio y poder satisfacer  las necesidades de los clientes.
Lesbia esta solicitando  este préstamo para reforzar su negocio y asi poder  comprar: arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, pollo, queso, etc. Ella considera que al comprar este tipo de productos su demanda en las ventas crecería y aumentaría la demanda de sus clientes, y podrá vender más, incrementando  de esta manera sus ingresos, ya que sus planes futuro es poder comprar más tierra  y su meta es reparar otra casa  que compro con su esposo para dejársela a sus hijos y tengan donde vivir.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 39 years old, and from the village of La Concha, Teustepe. She is the mother of 2 children aged 1 and 13. She went to work in Costa Rica for 6 years and saved the money she earned there to open a convenience store in Nicaragua. That was how she was able to buy her house.
She works in the convenience store that she has owned for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer and helps out by buying some supplies for her store. She is satisfied with the profits that her store is generating at the moment, because they will allow her to expand it in order to satisfy all of her clients’ needs.
Lesbia is requesting this loan to make her business stronger by buying rice, sugar, oil, ham, chicken, cheese, etc. She believes that by buying these types of products, her sales will increase, her client numbers will also increase, and therefore her income will be greater. Her future plan is to buy more land, and her ultimate goal is to renovate a house that she bought with her husband in order to leave it for their children so that they have somewhere to live.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, chicken, cheese, etc., for her convenience store.

loans.name: Yasmain

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmain is a 41-year-old active, married woman. She took the initiative to set up a general store business ten years ago when she realized that her husband's income is not sufficient for meeting household expenditures. She used a spare room for a small shop and put in general items of daily use, keeping in mind the people living around her and the kids who play in the streets. She started with consumer goods such as soft drinks, toiletries and grocery items which are the requirement of every house, and also sweet items for the children. After passing through different phases, her store is now fully stocked with items of daily use and she doesn’t want to lose any customer by saying no to any of their demands. 

Yasmain is a responsible mother of five and eager to fulfill their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. She has enhanced her business with the support of Kashf Foundation as she has been in association with Kashf for seven years. She is amongst the top loyal customers of Kashf. Now she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy additional items including stock of rice, grains, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from the market at wholesale prices. She will then be able to manage increasing demand efficiently. She intends to utilize the earned profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, grains, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from the market

loans.name: Nyiro

texts.en:
Nyiro has been involved in a small retail business for the past six years. She is 42 years old, married and she has six children.

She sells greens, fruits and vegetables. She works alone in this business. Beside the income she makes from her business, she also receives contributions from her husband. She aims at opening a tailoring business sometime. She is currently asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, etc.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar is an entrepreneurial person who is a widow and has 3 adult sons. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 12 years. Little by little, with the passing of the time and years, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the good condition of the animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are happy with her work.

Gavhar is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, in this way she will be able to offer her sons access to be financially stable and that will allow them to progress. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy cattle for developing the business further. Each month she will make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires avec en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Hamdallaye dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine Ségou. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments (piments, gombo, fakoye, etc.…). 
Dans le souci de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Tata (femme assise sur la photo à l’extrême gauche) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 800 kg de fakoye avec les forains des villages environnants de Ségou. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes à domicile, en ambulant  et au marché Château de Ségou. Avec ce prêt, madame Tata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer en condiments. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The majority of the women in the Benkadi group are married, in nuclear families, are on average 34 years old and have an average of five children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood in the city of Ségou, and know each other from their businesses in the Médine Ségou marketplace. They buy and sell condiments such as peppers, gumbo, and fakoye (an edible leaf of a wild plant.) 

In order to increase their capital, the group members have partnered with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle. 

Tata (the woman seated on the far left in the photo,) is a great seller of all kinds of condiments. She will use her loan to buy 800 kg of fakoye with the stallkeepers in the surrounding villages of Ségou. She makes sales in cash and credit to a mostly female clientele out of her home, while traveling, and in the Château de Ségou marketplace. With this loan, Tata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and take care of small household needs. Her goal is to buy a lot for residential use with this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments (« fakoye » : feuille d’une plante sauvage comestible).

loans.name: Virgencita De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DE GUADALUPE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones,polos,blusas y chompas, la socia vende ropa en forma indepedendiente llevando a sus amigas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, la socia en sus tiempos libres le gustas pasear a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos, chompas, pantalones y blusas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de confección de ropa, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de muebles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma is 32 years old, single, has 2 children, and is a member of the group. She works selling clothing such as pants, polo shirts, shirts, and sweaters. She sells her clothing independently by taking it to her friends. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and has been doing this for 5 years. Her business is going well, and in her free time she likes to go out with her children. Her dream is to have a store to sell the clothes from. She is requesting a loan to buy polo shirts, sweaters, pants, and shirts. 

The other members have businesses selling food, clothing, staple goods, and furniture.

This member is grateful to those who are helping her fulfill her dreams, and she is committed to making her loan repayments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, sweaters, pants, and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Ms. Raqia is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She is an active lady and doing a business of milk sales for eight years. Her husband assists her in selling milk door-to-door.  She has attained a good number of customers which are still increasing day by day. Her business is good enough to lead her to a decent life. She lives in a large, conventional family with her husband, children and other relatives.

She requires to earn more to cover the everyday expenditures of her family.  Now she requested a loan amount of 25,000 PKR. She will be using the loan with her savings to buy one more buffalo to inflate sales. She expects an increase in her business income and intends to utilize the earned profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to inflate sales

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 36 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora.  Convive con Ronald, y juntos tienen 04 hijos. Ellos habitan en su casa propia. Ella se esfuerza mucho para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por ello se dedica en la venta de pasamanería, siendo su puesto un espacio en la calle, frente de un colegio. Entre las cosas que vende, están los juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y accesorios de vestir sobre todo para las niñas.  Sale a diario en busca de algún colegio para ofrecer sus novedosos productos. Por tanto considera rentable su negocio, pues gana un promedio del 50% de su inversión. Comenta asimismo, que tuvo mucha dificultades cuando se inicio en el negocio, no sabia como llegar al cliente, ahora es sabe manejar bien la situación y convence a las personas a adquirir sus productos. Espera mas adelante tener una tienda, pero por ahora desea hacer crecer su negocio, para así obtener mayores ganancias. Este será el préstamo número 02 con MFP, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir con su inversión. Con el monto de 700 soles, comprará mercadería, entre las cosas que comprar tenemos juguetes, collares, pulseras, entre otros accesorios para su venta.
texts.en: Rosa, 36, is a kind, hardworking woman.  She lives with Ronald and they have four children together.  They live in their own house.  She works hard to be able to provide a better quality of life for her children which is why she works selling novelties.  Her stand is a space on the sidewalk in front of a school.  Among the things she sells are toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets and clothing accessories especially for girls.  She heads out daily to look for a school to sell her novelty items at.  She considers her business to be profitable because she earns on average 50% on her investment.  She also comments that she had many difficulties when she first started the business; she did not know how to approach customers but now she knows how to manage the situation well and convinces people to acquire her products.  She hopes later on to have a store but for now wants to make her business grow to earn higher profits.  This will be her second MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial backup to continue with her investment.  She will use the 700 soles to buy merchandise among which will be toys, necklaces, bracelets and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy toys, necklaces, bracelets and other accessories.

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la agricultura, desde hace 14 años. Su trabajo se especializa específicamente a la labranza o cultivo de la tierra y que además incluye todos los trabajos relacionados al tratamiento del suelo y a la plantación de vegetales. Se desempeña en esta labor junto con sus trabajadores de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en grandes distribuidoras que se especializan en vender abonos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará abono, semillas liquidas y pago a los trabajadores.
Una de las metas de Ximena es seguir creciendo y generar mayores ingresos para la familia y poder dar trabajo a personas que lo necesiten.
Ximena vive junto a su marido y dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es contar con mas recursos ya que tiene la necesidad de contar con mas recursos en el hogar, porque los hijos van creciendo y al  mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar y un buen futuro escolar.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral  y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Ximena’s part of the “Mis Sueños” (My Dreams) communal bank in the city of Talca.  She’s worked in agriculture for 14 years.  Her work consists specifically in cultivating the land and includes all tasks related to soil treatment and vegetable growing.  She works alongside her laborers from Monday through Saturday and she arranges her schedule according to availability.  The buys the merchandise and supplies as needed from large suppliers who specialize in selling manure at low cost which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy manure, liquid seeds and to pay laborers.  One of Ximena’s goals is to continue growing and earning higher family income and to be able to provide jobs for those who need them.

Ximena lives with her two children who are 17 and 15 years of age and attend school.  Her dream on a person level is to have more resources because she needs to have more for home because the children are growing and the need to give them a good life and future schooling increases.

She’s very grateful and happy with the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it opened a work portal and will allow her to invest in her business and in her personal development since she’s learned how to organize and manager her income and investments better.

Talca belongs to the Maule Region, a zone in the middle of the country.  It’s the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There’s a curious phrase about Talca in Chile that says: “Talca, Paris and London.”  Among the myths associated with is, some say it comes from something originally said by an Englishman “Talca parece Londres” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in winter similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy manure, liquids, seeds and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi, de 42 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, en toda su vida demostró ser una mujer muy pujante, pues es madre soltera y tuvo que criar a sus 02 hijos sola. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde les brinda educación y alimentación, ella desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
Deysi a diario se dedica en la crianza de aves de corral, siendo la huerta de su casa un lugar donde criar estos animales. Tiene más de 100 pollos, y cada cierto tiempo los lleva al mercado para su comercialización. Comenta que desde el comienzo hasta al finalizar la campaña le toma un promedio de 45 días. Dice que tiene buenos clientes pues siempre están a la expectativa de comprarle ya que sus pollos son muy buenos porque ella los cría con puro alimentos balanceados. Lleva trabajando en ésta actividad más de  06 años y le sirvió para poder salir adelante y progresar. Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo, aunque al principio se enfrentó con muchos problemas, entre ellos el de no saber como es el proceso completo de cada campaña, así como no saber que tendría que aplicarles vacuna a cada pollo. Pero ahora es todo una experta y cada día desea mejorar su manera de crianza. Este será el préstamo número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles, comprará pollos bebes para iniciar con su crianza y alimentos balanceados, además de algunas vitaminas y vacunas necesarias para su buen desarrollo de estas aves.
texts.en:
Deysi, 42 years old, is a good woman, friendly and very hardworking. Throughout her life she has proved to be an energetic woman and as a single mother she had to raise her two children alone. Together they live in their own home and she provides them education and food. She wants her children to have a better quality of life.

Deysi works daily raising poultry, raising the animals in the garden of her house. She has more than 100 chickens, and every once in awhile she takes them to market to sale. She says that from the beginning to the end the venture takes 45 days. She says that good clients are always waiting to buy as her chickens are very good because she raises them on pure animal feed. 

She has been working in this activity more than six years and it has helped her to succeed and progress. She likes her work because it permits her to plan her own time, although at first she faced many problems, including not knowing the complete process of each cycle, and not knowing that she should give each chicken a vaccination. But now she is completely an expert and each day she wants to improve her method of breeding. 

This will be her sixteenth loan though MFP. She is very happy knowing she has financial support, as she feels secure moving ahead in her business.

With the 1000 soles she has asked for, she will buy baby chickens to begin raising, animal feed, some vitamins and necessary vaccines for the good growth of these chickens.

loans.use: to buy young chickens, animal feed, vitamins and poultry vaccines

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety, de 30 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene 04 hijos y juntos habitan en su casa propia. Bety tiene como trabajo la venta de productos de primera necesidad, dicho productos lo compra al por mayor así utiliza minima inversion. Por otro lado se dedica al alquiler de mototaxis, siendo uno manejado por su hijo y el otro lo alquila, logrando precibir ganancias. Lleva trabajando con éste negocio más de 04 años. 
Considera rentable su negocio, además que le permite disponer y manejar su tiempo, cuenta que no fue fácil al momento de emprender éste negocio ya que las dudas y los temores le embargaban, pero poco a poco fue tomando mas fuerza y ahora cosecha el fruto de su esfuerzo.  Este será el préstamo numero 17 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, conservas, asimismo llevará al mecanico su vehiculo para su mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Bety is 30 years old and is a kind, friendly and responsible woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children and together they live in their own house. Bety works selling essential items, which she buys wholesale so that she can obtain a lower price. She also hires-out taxis, with one of them  being driven by her son and one being rented out. This allows her to earn an income. She had been working with this business for over 4 years. 

She considers her business to be profitable and it also allows her to organize her own time. She says that this was not easy when she first set up her business since doubts and fears inhibited her. However little by little she gained strength and she is now reaping the fruits of her hard work. This will be her 17th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support. With the amount she is asking for, of 1000 soles, she will buy products such as rice, sugar, oil and preserves. She will also take her vehicle to the mechanic for servicing.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and preserves and take her vehicle to the mechanic for servicing.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de modista y venta de carbón, desde hace 20 años. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Realiza arreglos en general en prendas de vestir, confecciona cortinaje, disfraces, fundas para sillones.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, donde encuentra gran variedad en productos y telas para la confecciones para dejar satisfecha a su clientela y para que vuelva con más pedidos a realizar, todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente carbón.
Una de las metas de Maria es tener un bazar, adaptado en su casa, para poder atender mas cómodamente a su clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar por una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a sus padres. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es emprender aun mas e implementar mas maquinarias de trabajo y dar la posibilidad de trabajo a otras personas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
María’s part of the “Mis Sueños” (My Dreams) communal bank in the city of Talca.  She’s worked as a dressmaker and charcoal merchant for twenty years.  She comments that she works from home from Monday through Saturday and arranges her schedule according to availability.  She does general clothes repairs, makes curtains, costumes and seat covers.  She buys the merchandise and supplies as needed in Santiago where she finds a wide variety of fabric and dressmaking supplies at low cost which is advantageous economically to satisfy customers so that they’ll return to order more. She will use the loan exclusively to buy charcoal.  

One of her goals is to have a home-based dress shop to tend to customers more comfortably and generate higher income in order to be able to have a better quality of life.  María lives with her parents.  Her dream on a work level is to be more enterprising and set up more work machinery and to provide employment for others.  She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her since it’s allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she feels very comfortable in company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank because they share different activities and interests which she has enjoyed.  With respect to the training provided during the meetings, she’s learned to better manage her business.

Talca belongs to the Maule Region, a zone in the middle of the country.  It’s the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There’s a curious phrase about Talca in Chile that says: “Talca, Paris and London.”  Among the myths associated with is, some say it comes from something originally said by an Englishman “Talca parece Londres” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in winter similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: José Erasmo

texts.es:
Don José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la pesca, aprendió cuando unos amigos lo invitaron que fuera con ellos al mar a pescar; antes se dedicaba a la agricultura y la albañilería. Manifiesta que la necesidad le hizo aprender muchas cosas para ganarse la vida y sostener a su familia. Es de esta manera, como José empezó con esa actividad, como vio que le dejaba buenos ingresos, con mucho esfuerzo compro una lancha y un motor usado, se introduce al mar durante dos días para pescar y salir con el producto.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar el motor de la lancha, ya que se le ha apagado y no arranca. Sin el motor en perfectas condiciones no puede ir a pescar y esa es su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Su deseo, es comprar un nuevo motor y un nuevo equipo de pesca, construir su casa, ya que donde vive no es de él y que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para la vida.
texts.en:
José, 41, is married and has two children.  He’s been fishing for ten years having learned from some friends who invited him to go to sea with them fishing.  He used to work in agriculture and construction.  He states that need has led him to learn many things in order to earn his livelihood and support his family.  This is how José started out in this activity and seeing that it produced good income with much effort he bought a boat and a used outboard motor.  He heads out to sea for two days of fishing to bring in product.

The loan he’s asking from Fundación Campo is to repair the boat’s motor because it’s shut down and will not start up again.  Without a motor in perfect condition he’s unable to go out fishing and this is his source of income to support his family.  His wish is to buy a new motor and new fishing equipment, to build his house because where he lives now isn’t his and that his children to go school and prepare themselves for life.

loans.use: to repair his outboard motor.

loans.name: Richard Rafael

texts.es: Richard, de 37 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León , casado, padre de 2 hijos , de oficio comerciante, se dedica la venta de repuestos y reparación de Bicicletas. Inicio con un pequeño préstamo que le hizo una vecina, fue ofreciendo su servicio de reparación de bicicletas de vecino a vecino poco tiempo después le agrego la venta de repuestos de bicicletas, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad  , en un pequeño local el cual alquila. Su esposa trabaja como estilista en belleza así se complementan para llevar a diario la comida para sus hijos. Está solicitando el financiamiento comprar llantas, rines de aluminio, marcos para bicicletas, neumáticos, asientos, valineras. Pues esto le ayuda a mantener surtido su negocio y atraer más clientela. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta vender repuestos de vehículos.
texts.en:
Richard, 37 years old, lives in the city of León. He is married and the father of two children. 

He works as a merchant, repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He began with a small loan he got through a neighbor, and was offering his bicycle repair service neighbor to neighbor and soon afterwards began to sell bicycle parts. He has been doing this activity for four years in a small facility that he rents.

His wife works as a stylist in a beauty salon and they share in the daily feeding of their children. 

He is asking for funding in order to buy tires, aluminum rims, bicycle frames, inner tubes, seats, and hubs. This will help him to maintain his business and attract more clients. One of his plans for the future is selling car parts.

loans.use: to buy tires, aluminum rims, bicycle frames, inner tubes, seats and hubs for his bicycle repair shop.

loans.name: Angie Geovana

texts.es:
Angie es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su madre y su pequeño hermano, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su madres, Angie se encuentra estudiando el último año de la carrera técnica de Hotelería, ella es muy buena estudiante y ocupa los primeros lugares dentro de su institución educativa.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Angie trabaja como empleada del hogar, ella brinda servicios de limpieza y también cuida a una persona de la tercera edad, Angie trabaja por las mañanas un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Angie se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realiza la compra de sus materiales de estudios para realizar la elaboración de una pequeña maqueta, el cual es un trabajo muy importante que se considera en sus calificaciones, así pues Angie espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante junto con su familia y espera lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Angie, 19, is a young woman living in Cañete in Imperial District with her mother and small brother who she loves and are the main reason for life.  She’s a kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to her effort and her mother’s support, Angie is in the final year studying the technical career of hotel management.  She’s a very good student and is always in the list of top students at her school.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Angie works as a domestic employee.  She does housecleaning chores and also cares for a senior citizen.  She works mornings for about 8 hours.  She feels good working and thinks she does well because of the good way she does her work and the kind way she treats others.

Angie is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she’ll be able to buy the study materials she needs to build a small model which is a very important graded assignment.  Angie will be able to continue working and striving to get ahead with her family and hopes to reach her dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Vianka Yocasta

texts.es:
Vianka, originaria de León, madre de 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Negocio que empezó al separarse de su ex esposo. Busco productos para vender por unidad y rápido sus primeros productos fueron las gaseosas y los snacks poco a poco fue surgiendo, escogió este negocio porque le permitía estar más cerca de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo recibir ingresos diarios, sentir que puede valerse por sí misma sin depender de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, enlatados, sopas, jugos, papel higiénico y productos de limpieza. Pues su sueño es lograr convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea surtida de variedad de productos alimenticios.
texts.en: Vianka is from León and is the mother of two children.  She’s a merchant by profession; she owns a grocery store.  The business started when she separated from her husband.  She sought out products she could sell quickly by the unit and her initial products were soft-drinks and snacks; she gradually developed.  She chose this business because it allowed her to be near her children while earning daily income and feel like she could fend for herself without depending on anyone else to support her children.  She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, canned goods, soups, toilet paper and cleaning supplies because her dream is to convert her grocery store into a variety store well-stocked with food items.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maynor David

texts.es:
Maynor, 31 años de edad, casado, padre de 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, de oficio comerciante y técnico en computadoras. Inicio su negocio hace 4 años con el apoyo de un hermano 	que vive en el extranjero, compro su primer servidor poco a poco fue formando un pequeño Cyber , su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosméticos de esta manera ambos sostienen a su familia. 
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar una computadora, memorias, mouse y teclados. Pues la tecnología va avanzando y necesita mantenerse actualizado ofreciendo máquinas para rápidas con el objetivo de no perder a su clientela sobre todo el sector joven quienes son los que más visitan su negocio. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta comprar su propio local para no estar alquilando, diversificar su negocio ofrecer recargas telefónicas y mejorar el servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Maynor is 31 years old, married and father of one son, who is four years old. He makes a living as a merchant and a computer technician. He started his business four years ago with the support of a brother, who lives abroad. He purchased his first server and little by little, he transformed it into a small internet cafe. 

His wife works selling cosmetics and in this way both support their family. 

He requests a loan to purchase a computer, memories, mouse, and keyboards. Because the technology is moving fast, he needs to be updated by offering faster machines with the objective not to lose his clients, in particular the youth, who are the most frequent clients of his business.
