loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transport service business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer was studying business administration in Argentina when one day her dad called her to give her some good advice. He suggested she move to the United States to finish her studies and follow in his footsteps. The energetic and devoted daughter agreed, and she and her husband packed up and moved to Miami two years ago. 

With the help of her father, Jennifer learned the ins and outs of vending machines. “I learned the trade from my father. He has good vision as a businessman and was very generous in helping me buy my first machine in Miami at a good price,” said Jennifer. Finally, in 2010, Jennifer launched her own company, Southern ATM’s. 

Jennifer has been operating her business with 16 vending machines. In order to keep up with the rapidly changing technology, she is seeking a loan to be able to purchase five new machines.

loans.use: to buy five new machines

loans.name: Charmie

texts.en:
Charmie is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 28 years old, married, with 2 children. 

To make a living, Charmie offers and runs a vulcanizing (tire repair) shop, and a retail store. Charmie has been in her business for 2 years, and earns 6,000 PHP a month with these activities. 

In 2011, Charmie joined GDMPC. Charmie is requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Faridakhon

texts.ru: Фаридахону 18 лет. Она успешно закончила физико-математический лицей и данный момент является студенткой 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции по специальности Бухгалтер и аудит. Она активно участвует в жизни университета. Фарида является заместителем старосты в группе. В свободное время она шьет платья себе и своим подругам. Будущим она хочет стать успешным бухгалтером и зарабатывать достаточного средства для проживания. Она должна заплатить за учебный год, но доход ее родителей не хватает для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 750 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она нуждается и ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Faridakhon is 18 years old. She successfully completed the Physics and Mathematics High School and is currently a first-year student at Tajik State University of Commerce with a specialization in accounting and auditing. She is actively involved in university life. Farida is the deputy leader of her group. In her spare time, she sews clothing for herself and friends. In the future, she wants to become a successful accountant and to earn money to live. 

She needs to pay for the school year, but her parents' income is not enough for this. She is asking for a loan of $750 to pay for her university studies. She needs and is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Né vers 1964 à Sikasso, Monsieur Daouda est polygame avec deux épouses et est père de quatre enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani I, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Après plusieurs années dans le métier de chauffeur, il décida il y a maintenant quatre ans de s’initier au métier familial qu’est le métier de forgeron. Il achète des ferrailles pour en faire des objets de différentes sortes : Charrues, Semoirs, Charrettes, Dabas, Marmites, etc. qui seront vendus dans les marchés hebdomadaires des localités environnantes de Sikasso tels N’Tchongobougou, Kadiolo et Hérémakono au comptant et souvent à crédit. Il est beaucoup sollicité et les commandes de ses clients ne cessent d’augmenter mais ses ressources propres sont insuffisantes pour mieux satisfaire les attentes de sa clientèle. Ainsi pour palier ces problèmes, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 4 tonnes de ferraille.
En plus des marchés hebdomadaires, il mène des prestations dans sa forge qui se trouve en pleine cœur de la ville de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1964 in Sikasso, Monsieur Daouda is polygamous and has two spouses and four children. He lives with his family in a large, extended traditional family in Mancourani I in downtown Sikasso.

After working for several years as a driver, four years ago he decided to follow the family tradition and become a blacksmith. He buys scrap metal and transforms it into various types of objects: plows, drilling machines, carts, hoes, pots, etc. He sells these at the weekly markets near Sikasso (N’Tchongobougou, Kadiolo, and Hérémakono) for cash and often on credit. 

He is very sought after and his clients' orders are constantly increasing, but his personal resources aren't enough to meet his clients’ needs. For this reason, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He's on his third loan, which will allow him to buy four tons of scrap metal. 

In addition to the weekly markets, he works in his foundry right in the heart of Skiasso. With his loan, he would like to earn an average monthly income of 175,000 FCFA, which he'll use to help out with the family expenses, pay interest on his loan, and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años convive con la madre de sus 2 hijas. Ellos habitan un hogar propio ubicado en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Juan es un hombre trabajador. Desde los 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que le ha permitido obtener más terrenos y una casa propia. “Gracias a la agricultura he podido comprar muchas cosas, por eso sigo trabajando, las ganancias se obtienen de acuerdo al esfuerzo”, dice orgulloso.
Actualmente cuenta con4 hectáreas de café, otras 7 de plátanos, frutos cítricos y paltas, las que comercializa después de cosecharlas en dos mercados diferentes. Además menciona que, tuvo que afrontar momentos difíciles en su trabajo, como la pérdida de una siembra entera de plátanos por las enfermedades, por ello ahora tiene más cuidado.
Estos días son cruciales para esparcir abono orgánico a sus cultivos y realizar la limpieza. Así los tendrá listos para la siguiente cosecha. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP. Se siente agradecido por el apoyo brindado anteriormente, por eso dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y le agrada el trabajo con las cuentas internas.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de  abono orgánico, como guano de ave de corral para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 and lives with his two daughters and their mother. They live in their own home in an indigenous community in the rainforest. For 20 years, Juan, a hardworking man, has been farming. He has been able to acquire more land and buy his own house. "Thanks to farming, I has been able to buy many things, so I keep working because you earn profits by working hard," he says proudly. 

He now has four hectares of coffee and seven more of plantains, citrus fruits, and avocados. After the harvest, he sells the crops in two markets. He says that he has faced tough times, for example, when he lost his entire plantain crop to disease, and now he is more careful. Right now it is crucial that he fertilize and clear the plantings to be ready for the next harvest. 

This is his fifth loan cycle with MFP. He is thankful for the previous loans and promises to make his monthly payments on time. He belongs to the communal bank “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” and likes to manage the group's accounts. He will use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer such as bird manure to spread on his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Chery

texts.en:
Chery is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 26 years old, married, with 2 children.  

To make a living, Chery cultivates bananas for sale. Chery been been in her business for 5 years, and earns 3,000 PHP a month from this.  

In 2010, Chery joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer used in raising bananas. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer used in raising bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Primetiva

texts.en: Primetiva is from Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Primetiva is married and has four children. To make a living, Primetiva sells snack food items, which she has been doing for four years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Primetiva joined GDMPC. Primetiva is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP, which she will use to procure more snack foods like chips and colas. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to procure more snack foods like chips and colas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, cheese, cream, beverages, grains, and soap.

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos, quiere aumentar la producción de su cultivo, actualmente está realizando esta labor agrícola, para eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le facilite los recursos para comprar abono, herbicidas y otros insumos que son necesarios.
Con el préstamo anterior Santos comenta que tuvo una experiencia buena, trabajo con mozos a quienes les pago por su servicio, ya que de la cosecha le resulto ganancias para cubrir los costos.
texts.en: Santos wants to increase his crop production. He is a farmer and is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizer, weed killer, and other necessary supplies. Santos says that his previous loan was a success. He hires other laborers, since the profits from the harvest will cover their wages.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and weed killer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old, a widow with 4 children. She is from Kinuman, Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Leonora cultivates bananas and coconuts to sell. She's been in this business for 4 years, and earns 4,500 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC.  She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is widow with 7 children. She is 61 years old and lives in Balili, Kinuman, Ozamis City. 

To earn a living, Felina plants and harvests bananas for sale. She's been in this business for 30 years, and each month, she earns 10,000. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, Felina joined GDMPC. In the future, Felina wants to make improvements to her house and to better the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for the bananas she grows.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 40, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bella operates a market stall. She sells fruit in the community market. She buys large quantities of fruits and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more fruit in order to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bella dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fruit needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, quiere surtir el negocio de la venta de frutas, verduras y tostadas, para solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar cebollas, repollo, tomates, zanahorias, plátanos, aceite, con esto le dará mas capacidad al negocio y podrá seguir realizando su venta.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar el negocio, ha comprado un coche de bicicleta para salir a vender, en su hogar el número de miembros se mantiene, su deseo es continuar mejorando su hogar y el negocio.
texts.en:
María wants to stock her business with fruits and vegetables and fried goods to sell. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will help her to buy onions, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, plátanos (banana variety), and oil. This will help her increase her sales and expand her business.

According to María, her previous loan allowed her to improve her business and she bought a bicycle to go out and sell more of her foods. Since she is still providing for the members of her family, her goal is to continue improving her home and her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, plátanos (banana variety), and oil.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, solicita un crédito para seguir cultivando y comprando materiales para el taller, estas dos actividades las realiza en conjunto, se comprara abono, herbicidas, además comprara hierro y lamina, que son los necesarios para poder realizar para aplicarlos al cultivo y tambien la compra de materiales para el taller.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo, ya que cultivo lo planeado, tuvo algunas pérdidas en la cosecha, pero al mismo tiempo salió una buena parte para realizar la venta.
Su condición en la familia se mantiene, sus ingresos han alcanzado a cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en: Luis is applying for a loan to continue planting and to buy materials for his workshop; he works at both professions. He will buy fertilizer, weed killer, iron, and sheet steel: things he needs for his crops and for the workshop. He thinks the previous loan was a success because most of the crops he planted yielded a good harvest, though he did incur some losses, and sold well. He has been able to support his family, earn more income, and pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, iron, and sheet steel.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She has been selling avocados, onions and tomatoes at both retail and wholesale for the last nine years, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income. Rose has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more tomatoes, onions and avocados for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to drop her retail business and focus on wholesale. She joined MCDT because of the low interest they charge on loans.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, avocados, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and has 7 children. 

To make a living, Leslie raises hogs for sale. Leslie been in her business for 7 years, and earns 3,000 PHP a month for this. 

In 2009, Leslie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en: Tungalagtamir is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Lkhagva, provide taxi service and his monthly income is around 300.000 MNT. Her older daughter Narmandakh, is 11, her younger daughter Naranchimeg, is 10 and her son Naranbaatar, is 4. Her two daughters go to primary school and her son goes to kindergarten. Tungalagtamir has been managing a clothes retail business since 2000. She imports clothes for 1.500.00 MNT from China once a month. She sells to local residents on a rented counter of a local trading center. She is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to import warm winter clothes for seasonal sale. She is a friendly woman who plans to improve her family's living condition by renovating her old house.

loans.use: to import warm winter clothes for seasonal sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man. He has been working as a bus driver for 4 years. In 2009, Ahmad started his own business, when he bought his own van to transport students to/from school.

Ahmad is a Palestinian refugee, and he suffers from the limited choices of work they face, that's why he insisted on starting his own business to make sure that he will develop and improve it in the coming future.

Ahmad has applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. With the loan he will complete necessary maintenance on his bus, he will fix its benches and do necessary painting. He will continue to make sure that it's in very good shape until he can afford to buy a wider new one in the future.
It is his only source of income, and he will make sure that it will always improve and develop for a better future he dreams about.

loans.use: To complete necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Rea Jean

texts.en:
This is Rea Jean, 27, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a driver, and she is a mother. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.   

Rea Jean operates a street-vending business. She sells hotdogs, barbecue, large intestine of chicken, and other street foods. Customers are attracted  to the low prices and the many products she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors, as well as the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rea Jean hopes that her business will continue to be successful, and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products for her street- vending business.

loans.name: Darinchuluun

texts.en: Darinchuluun is 56 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband helps her business. Her her older daughter is a university school student and her younger daughter is a high school student. She started her business in 2006 selling organic fruit and vegetables at the local market. Currently, she operates both an organic fruit and vegetable business and a clothes retail business. She buys organic fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar city. She is planning to expand her business by reserving bulk amounts of organic fruits and vegetables. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "Husband and I need to work hard to let our daughter be highly educated for a bright future." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy bulk amounts of organic fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy bulk amounts of organic fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marta Gladis

texts.es:
Marta, vive con sus hijos, todos están en un mismo terreno pero distintas casas, ella trabaja sola, realizando ventas de antojitos y siembras de maíz, este negocio lo realiza al frente de un centro de educación, ofrece tamales de elote, elotes locos, atol, y lo realiza todos los días.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de elotes, hoja de huerta, que son necesarios para hacer los tamales y elotes locos, tambien comprara abono y herbicidas para iniciar el cultivo de maíz. Esto le ayudara para realizar la siembra, tambien realizara su venta de antojitos.
Su aspiración es continuar trabajando en el negocio, apoyar a un nieto para que asista a la escuela.
texts.en:
Marta lives on the same plot of land as her children, though they all live in separate houses. She works by herself, selling snack items and the corn products. She has a stand located in front of the center of education, where each day she offers her customers corn tamales, corn on the cob with different toppings, and atol (hot drinks made with a corn base).

Marta is requesting a loan to buy corn, hoja de huerta (leaves used to make tamales and corn on the cobs), fertilizer, and weed-killer in order to start growing corn. This will help her sow her crops as well as help with her snack sales. Marta's dream is to continue this business and help with the educational expenses of her grandchild.

loans.use: to buy corn, hoja de huerta (leaves used to make tamales), fertilizer, and weed-killer.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold, who is 47, drives a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar city, the capital city of Mongolia. He is widowed and now lives with his mother and daughter in the slum district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. His mother is on a pension and his daughter is a university student. His monthly earnings are not enough for his family's necessities. He has been running his business, which his father initially taught him, since 2003. Now Batbold needs to renovate his taxi car for better quality service. He says that it will help him to improve his business and increase his earnings. He will repair and renovate his car by himself. This is his second loan from Kiva. As you know, Mongolia is one of the coldest countries in the world and borders with the Siberia to the north. Before the winter comes he wants to repair his car. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing spare parts for his car renovation.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to renovate his car.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
This is Mary Jean, 38, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Ruben, a collector, and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mary Jean maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought with cash by the dealer (Mary Jean), and then the merchandise is given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The prices dealers pay for the items are lower than those in the catalog, and this difference is the profit that a dealer like Mary Jean counts on, as her income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Mary Jean hopes to give her children a good and quality education, and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to order and pay for clothing, footwear and other products, while waiting for reimbursement from her customers who buy on credit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
This is Christine, 33, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Single, she lives with her parents and helps them manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Christine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns revenue by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP15,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Christine hopes to have a good life through all the hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her small convenience store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Nocnocan, Talibon. For more than 20 years, she has been engaged in two businesses: food vending and a sari-sari store (variety store). Yolanda is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for cooking, such as meat, vegatables, seasoning, and others. With this, she will be able to cook more food to sell to the people in the locality. In the future, Yolanda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking such as meat, vegatables, seasoning and others

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en: Dolgor is 28 years old, lives with her husband and son in a small house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Munkhbat, is temporarily unemployed and her son, Sugardorj, goes to primary school. She has been selling clothes at a rental counter of the local market since 2006. She is an optimistic, hardworking person. She and her husband are planning to buy a car and let her husband be self-employed as a taxi driver. Her husband has been working as a shift driver of various types of vehicle for years and has lot of experience in driving any type of vehicle. Dolgor is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a Hyundai Accent car for her husband to start a taxi service business to contribute family income. Borrower and her husband are also planning to improve their housing in the near future.

loans.use: to buy Hyundai Accent car for her husband to start taxi service business to contribute to family income.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli, 52, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Frank, a driver, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, Araceli manages their household while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Araceli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business. 

Araceli hopes to give her children a good and quality education, and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to sell at retail in her store.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
Matagalpa una bella ciudad, importante por su gran producción de caficultura ubicada en el norte de Nicaragua, es originario José Francisco  hombre humilde de muchos esfuerzo, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su compañera de vida y su dos hijo ambos en edad escolar.

José se desempeña como albañil en una empresa de servicio potable desde hace más de seis años, con los ingresos de su salario son destinado para suplir los gasto de su hogar.

Necesita realizar alguna mejora en su vivienda pero con su salario se vuelve un poco más difícil de hacer las mejora es por tal razón que solicita este crédito para destinarlo para la compra de piso cerámica y a si poder realizar la mejora.
José manifestó que se siente agradecido con kiva y ceprodel por brindarle el apoyo a través de este crédito ya que le dará mejor condición a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Matagalpa is a beautiful city that is located in northern Nicaragua. It has great importance due to the heavy production of coffee. José Francisco, a native of this area, is a humble man who works very hard. His family consists of his life companion and their two school-age children.

José has worked as a mason for a sanitation services company for more than six years. The income from his salary is used to provide for the household expenses. José needs to make a few improvements to his home, but his salary makes it a bit difficult for him to pursue these projects. For this reason, he is requesting this loan so that he can buy ceramic floor tiles in order to complete one of these improvements.

José says that he is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for assisting him with this loan, which will result in a home that is in better condition.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor tiles.

loans.name: Gennadiy

texts.ru:
Геннадий  - фермер. С этого года начал заниматься выращиванием персикового сада.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с участка земли, которая досталась в наследство от отца
Петр решил приобрести, дисковую барану для облегчения своего труда, т.к вспашка и обработка сада – тяжелый процесс.
В планах на будущие:  расширение своего участка, насаждение персиковых деревьев.
В личных планах: постройка жилого дома.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования дисковой бараны.
texts.en:
Gennadiy is a farmer. This year he began cultivating a peach orchard. His development activities began with a piece of land, which was inherited from the father. Gennadiy decided to purchase a ram disk to facilitate his work, such as plowing and garden treatment -- a tough process. 

Plans for the future: expansion of the site, planting peach trees.
On a personal note: construction of a house.

He needs your help to fund the ram disk.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né vers 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur  Hamidou Ousmane  est un célibataire résidant dans une traditionnelle avec  son cousin à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.      
Hamidou Ousmane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études s’est très vite initié depuis plus de dix années à cette activité d’achat et vente des téléphones portable et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.). Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et de transporteurs. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits tous correctement remboursés. Ainsi, il sollicite ce sixième crédit  pour acheter à Bamako, 60 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 10 cartons de façade, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 30 paquets de carte mémoire, 25 cartons de batterie, 15 douzaines d’écouteur de différentes sortes, une dizaine de montres différentes et  des ceintures. 
      Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Hamidou Ousmane was born in Zegoua (border of Mali and Ivory Coast) around 1988. He is a single man who lives in a traditional family with his cousin in Sanoubougou II, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso. 

Having not had the opportunity to pursue his studies, Hamidou learned early on the business of buying and selling mobile phones and accessories (skin cases, batteries, chargers, headphones, etc.) over 10 years ago. He conducts his business in his own shop at the Sikasso bus station, and his clientele consists mainly of travelers and carriers. He is in high demand due to the quality of his merchandise. 

Eager to meet the needs of his growing customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where he has previously received five loans, all correctly repaid. 

He is seeking a sixth loan to go to Bamako to purchase 60 mobile phones of various brands, 10 boxes of skin cases, about 15 chargers, 30 packs of memory cards, 25 boxes of batteries, 15 dozen set of headphones in different styles, and an assortment of watches and belts. 

He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 175,000 FCFA, which he will use primarily to help with the household expenses and to pay the interest on the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in his activity.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Ramon Eduardo

texts.es:
El Señor Ramón tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, reside en compañía de 2 de sus hijos menores y esposa  en  el municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Ramón hace 9 años que se dedica al transporte de personas a través de un taxi, el transita la ciudad en busca de pasajeros pero también tiene contratos con personas asalariadas y a estudiantes.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la reparación de su vehículo a traves del cambio de amortiguadores, compra de llantas y reparaciones menores.
Considera que al mantener la unidad de transporte en buen estado sus clientes viajan mas cómodos y les ofrece un mejor servicio.
En el futuro Ramón espera aumentar su clientela, sus ingresos y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ramón, 48, is married and has three children; he lives with two of the minor ones and with his wife in Tela, Atlántida Department.  He’s been working providing passenger taxi services for nine years.  He drives through the city looking for passengers but also has contracts with salaried employees and students.  He’s currently asking for a 21,000 Lempira loan he plans to use to repair his vehicle; he will replace the shock absorbers, buy tires and small spare parts.  He feels that by keeping the vehicle in good condition his passengers travel more comfortably and he offers better service.  In future, Ramón hopes to increase his clientele and his income to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Luaao Lusia

texts.en: Luaao Lusia is 59 years old and married with seven children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Ice cake in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as foam cups, drink mix, sack sugar, Chinese lollies, etc. In the future, Luaao Lusia hopes to improve her business and pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, sugar, flavorings for her ice cake business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 56-year-old, married woman and mother of five children, from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She has owned and run a sari-sari (convenience) store for more than 30 years. This is the source of her income.

Maria wants a loan so she can stock up on items to resell in her store, such as noodles, canned goods, snack foods, seasonings and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to attract more customers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to stock up on items to resell in her store, such as noodles, canned goods, snack foods, seasoning and toiletries.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela. She previously received a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Angela would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angela hopes that her children will have a good life and that their house will be renovated. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hansel

texts.en:
Hansel is a 22-year-old fisherman from Nocnocan, Talibon. He is married and has two young children. He has been engaged in the fishing business for more than three years now. This is his main source of income.

Hansel is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing such as fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets, as well as to buy additional piglets to raise. As a result of this loan, he will be able to improve his daily earnings, which will allow him to provide for the needs of his family and the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets, as well as to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru: Абдунаби живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского р-на. Ему 54 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих сыновей.  Абдунаби работает бригадиром, у него  имеется группа мастеров, которые оказывают строительные услуги.  Под его руководством группа  строит и ремонтирует дома.  Жена Абдунаби дома занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота. Сыновья работают в Российской Федерации и по возможности присылают родителям денежные средства. Абдунаби хочет достроить свой дом который начал строить  для своего младшего сына. То что он накопил этого не хватает для стройки, поэтому он обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.  Заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Abdunabi lives in the J. Rasulov rural district . He is 54 years old. He is married and has two sons. Abdunabi works as a foreman. He has a group of artisans who provide construction services. His team builds and renovates homes. 

Abdunabi's wife fattens cattle at their home. His sons work in the Russian Federation and, as possible, send money home to their parents. Abdunabi wants to finish his house that he began to build for his younger son. This amount was not enough for the construction, so he turned to Arvand for financial support. 

Thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy  building materials

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахрому 20 лет. Его родители живут на Севере Таджикистана, а он сам переехал на столицу, чтобы поступить в университет. Он студент 3 курса Аграрного Университета Таджикистана. Он является одним из успешных студентов и активно участвует в жизни университета. Бахром должен оплатить за учебный договор, но доход его родителей не хватает для этого. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, вместе ему поможем окончить университет.
texts.en:
Bahrom is 20 years old. His parents live in the north of Tajikistan, but he lives on his own in the capital to go to university. He is a third-year student at the Agrarian University of Tajikistan. He is one of the successful students and is actively involved in university life. Bahrom must pay for his school contract, but his parents' income is not enough for this. 

He is requesting a loan to pay for the school contract. He is awaiting your kindness. Let's help him together to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Víveres, renchos y bebidas, fue lo que compró Daniela con su anterior credikiva, con el que aumentó su inventario y así mismo las ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un nuevo credito, con el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, bebida; su inversión tendrá éxito porque está localizada en un punto muy concurrido, donde lleva mucho tiempo de permanencia y es muy reconocida por su vecindad. Su mensaje a los finaciadoresde Kiva es el siguiente: "Gracias por apoyarme en crecer. "
texts.en: Daniela used her previous Kiva loan to buy food items, snacks and beverages she used to increase her inventory and as a result, her sales.  She’s currently applying for a new loan to buy food items, snacks and beverages.  The investment will be successful because she’s located in a very busy spot and has been there for a long time so she’s well-known in her neighborhood.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thanks for helping me grow.”

loans.use: to buy food items, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, Administra una tienda de venta de granos básicos y productos de primera necesidad, él vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, todos dependen económicamente de él, Este negocio está instalado en la vivienda de un familiar, donde lo atienden todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa, ya que es una fuente mayor de ingresos para el hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros productos que son necesarios para el negocio, este crédito le ayudara a que su negocio tenga los productos deseados, para atender a los clientes para que se mantengan comprando.
Su aspiración es tener mayores ingresos para que sus hijos sigan estudiando, tambien esto le servirá para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos manages a store selling basic grains and basic staples.  He lives with his family consisting of his wife and two children who are 12 and 7 years of age; all depend on him economically.  The business is located at home and he and his wife tend to it daily since it’s the family’s main source of income.

He’s requesting a loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans and sugar among other products needed for the business.  This loan will help his store have the desired products to tend to customers so that they will continue buying.  His hope is to earn higher income so his children can stay in school and also so that he can help his parents.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en: Faipaipai is 21 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for two years. Fiapaipai has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, box of chicken leg quarters, and other necessary ingredients. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiapaipai will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, boxes of chicken, sausages, sauce,  and oil..

loans.name: Uaine

texts.en: Uaine is 29 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells printed clothes to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Uaine has requested a loan to buy materials, paints, brushes, and elei wood. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Uaine joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, brushes, and elei wood.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a married woman and a mother of three young children, from Talibon, Bohol. She has run a water refilling business for almost three years. This is the source of her income.

Dulce works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of their children. Dulce is asking for a loan to buy more containers for her water refilling business. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy more containers for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Izzatullo

texts.ru: Иззатулло проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Жена Иззатулло домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Иззатулло разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Иззатулло берет кредит для закупа бычков и коров, чтобы продолжить свое дело.
texts.en:
Izzatullo lives in the Bohtar region. He is 38 years old, married and has five children. Izzatullo's wife is a homemaker. On his own, he engages in raising livestock. Izzatullo breeds cattle for sale in the future. He has been engaged in this type of activity for 15 years. 

Izzatullo is taking a loan to buy bulls and cows, in order to continue his activities.

loans.use: to buy bulls and cows

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор второй раз кредитуется в нашей организации. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Гулбахор разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она берет кредит для закупа бычков и быка.
texts.en: Gulbahor is taking a loan from our organization for the second time. She wants to expand her activities. Gulbahor breeds cattle near her home. She is taking a loan to buy bulls and an ox.

loans.use: to buy bulls and an ox

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Нуриддин проживает в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Нуриддин зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области ему помогает его жена. Нуриддин разводит скот у себя дома. У него дома имеются необходимые условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Скотоводством он занимается десять лет. 
Нуриддин берет кредит для закупа телят и бычков.
texts.en:
Nuriddin lives in the Zafarobod district of the city of Istaravshan. He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Nuriddin makes his living by breeding cattle. His wife helps him with this work. Nuriddin breeds livestock near his home. His house has the necessary conditions for raising cattle. He has been doing this work for ten years. 

Nuriddin is taking a loan to buy calves and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase calves and bulls

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda de 55 años, vive con su pareja, ya que sus hijos ya dejaron el hogar. Su vivienda es propia y se ubica en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 35 años atrás, cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños. De esa manera logró educarlos y criarlos. Ahora ella y su esposo se encargan de limpiar y cultivar sus productos. “En mis 4 parcelas de terrenos tenemos cultivados café, kión, yuca, paltas y frutos cítricos; así no nos falta dinero para todo el año”, menciona.
Hermelinda es muy inteligente, sabe como negociar sus productos, por eso los lleva a los mercados en fechas determinadas, cuando los precios son más beneficiosos.
Estos días se dirigirá a los montes (donde están sus parcelas), para dedicarse a las limpiezas y mantenimiento de sus cultivos, para ello requiere bolsas de abono orgánico, son sus planes más cercanos. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP. Anteriormente mostró puntualidad en los pagos, y no duda en hacerlo esta vez. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, y le agrada el trabajo que se realiza.
Con el dinero podrá comprar las bolsas de abono orgánico necesarias para sus cultivos de café, kión y paltas.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 55, lives with her spouse since her children have already left home.  Her house is hers and is located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  She’s been working in agriculture for 35 years since when her children were little.  She managed to raise them and school them this way.  Now, she and her husband are in charge of weeding and growing their products.  “On my four parcels of land, we grow coffee, ginger, manioc, avocadoes and citrus fruit; this way we earn money year-round,” she mentions.  Hermelinda is very intelligent; she knows how to negotiate her products which is why she takes them to market on determined days which is when prices are most beneficial.

In these days she heads up into the mountains (where here parcels are located) to do the weeding and crop maintenance.  To do so, she needs sacks of organic manure; this is her most immediate plan.  This will be MFP loan #5.  She was punctual with her previous payments and has no doubt she’ll be so again now.  She’s a member of the “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” (Shankivironi Little Carnations) and she likes the work it does.  She will be able buy sacks of organic manure needed for the coffee, ginger and avocado crops with the money.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and shrimp

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Argentina is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope) 4. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She is a divorced woman.

Argentina sells miscellaneous products from her home--products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and others. She started her business with some savings and by taking credits from different suppliers. This is how she financed her business until she was invited to a meeting where her neighbors explained about Esperanza International and this program. She was very excited and took her first loan to invest in her business. That was four years ago. Now, she is taking her eighth loan with Esperanza International.  

Argentina is excited to be taking this loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She is planning to use it to increase her inventory. She will reinvest her profits in her desire to expand her business into a Fantasia (a small miscellaneous product store). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, age 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Together with her children she manages their household, while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also sells RTW (ready-to-wear clothing), for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her prepared food business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for meals, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lourdes hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will have a good future, by the grace of God. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more ingredients for the meals she prepares and sells, including meats, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Liutasi

texts.en: Liutasi is 51 years old, married, and has nine children. She would like to start a sewing business. In order to do so, Liutasi is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine, materials, needles, and scissors. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and provide a better future for her children. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, materials, needles, and scissors.

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en: Isapela is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing a vegetable garden to earn a living. Isapela has requested a loan to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, chemicals, a water hose, and seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Isapela will spend her profits to extend and improve her business and for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, a water hose, and gloves.

loans.name: Salu Akenese

texts.en: Salu Akenese is 52 years old and married with 12 children. She would like to start a small sewing business. In order to do this, Salu Akenese needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, more materials, and other supplies. She hopes to use her profits to improve and maintain her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, materials, and fabric.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa Librada”  están  en el Tercer Ciclo   con 19  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes, pero también trabajan juntas y así están pasando sin problemas los ciclos.
Lucia, una de las miembros, cuenta que ella vende comestibles de todo tipo, y que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tuvo muy buena habilidad para la cocina y que ahora eso la ayuda a salir adelante. Su meta es poder tener un gran comedor y así trabajar.
Pide esta ayuda para la compra de condimentos, carnes, aderezos y demás, para seguir haciendo los alimentos que siempre hace.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Santa Librada" is in its third loan cycle with 19 members.  This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood by being very united, supportive, and responsible.  They have different businesses, but they also work together and they are completing the loan cycles without problems. 

Lucia, one of the members, says that she sells foods of all types and that she is doing well.  She was always skilled in the kitchen and now that helps her to move forward.  Her goal is to have a big restaurant and work that way.

She is asking for help to buy condiments, meats, seasoning, and the like in order to continue making the foods that she always makes.

loans.use: to buy condiments, meats, seasoning, etc

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru: Саиднисо   работает в типографии переплетчицей уже много лет.  У неё двое взрослых детей, которые имеют свои семьи.  Сын Саиднисо живет с матерью в одном доме и помогает ей в хозяйстве. Она постоянно работала в бюджетной организации и зарабатывала на жизнь, вырастила и выдала дочь из своей зарплаты со своим мужем.  Супруги частично распределяли свою получку на свои расходы и  не могли откладывать.  Саиднисо  получив кредит, намного улучшила свои бытовые условия и провела несколько мероприятий и частично оплачивала. Ей понравилось и теперь не переставая получает наши кредиты,потому что, не может накопить большие суммы. На полученный кредит хочет купить мягкую мебель о котором так  долго мечтала.  Она благодарит нас за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Saidniso has been working in printing for many years. She has two grown children who are married. Saidniso's son lives with his mother in one house and helps with the household. She always worked in the public organization to make a living, raise and married off her daughter out of her salary with her husband. The spouses partially distribute their pay to cover their expenses and they couldn't be postponed.  

Saidniso got a loan, much improved her living conditions, held several events and partially repaid. She liked it and now continually receives our loans, because she cannot accumulate large amounts. She wants to use the loan to buy furniture for which she has long dreamed. She thanks us for the financial support. 

She always worked in the public organization and make a living, grow and give her daughter out of her salary to her husband. Spouses partially distribute their pay at their costs and could not be postponed.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 39 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  16 y 18 años que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica a la fabricación de muñecas artesanales, ella tiene un puesto fijo donde los vende y los distribuye cuando tiene pedidos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria utilizara el préstamo para compra de material como ( tela, lana, hilos, silicona) para la fabricación de sus muñecas ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha mas demanda con algunas instituciones que le realizan pedidos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es un incremento en los pedidos de sus clientes y la falta de capital para la compra de material por mayor, Maria va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de material para incrementar la producción de muñecas y por ende  su capital su deseo es contar con una microempresa y poder contratar nano de obra.
texts.en: María, 39, is single with two children who are 16 and 18 years of age and attending school.  She works making artisanal dolls and has a fixed stand where she sells them; she also distributes them based on prior orders.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and María will use the loan to buy supplies like fabric, yarn, thread and silicone to make dolls because demand at the end of the year is much higher from institutions that place orders with her.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the increase in customer orders and lack of capital to buy supplies at wholesale.  María will use profits to buy supplies to increase doll production and thus her capital.  Her wish is to have a micro business and hire staff.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make dolls.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is a 44-year-old woman and the head of a household that includes her mother and her five children. They live in a Ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Bayarjargal, is 23 and works at a private mining company. Her second son, Bayarbayasgalan, is 20 and disabled and stays at home. Her younger three children, Buyanhishig, Sukhbat and Bazarsad, are secondary school students. 

Tuya has been running a grocery store business at a rental counter in the local market for years. Unfortunately, business has been temporarily stopped for months because of a lack of working capital. She is now requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase various types of goods for her grocery store. She is a hardworking, brave, and responsible woman.

loans.use: To purchase various types of goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Gregoria has run a sari-sari, or convenience, store business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Gregoria is requesting a loan to buy additional stocks to sell such as soda, canned goods, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to sell more goods to the people in her location. In the future, Gregoria dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soda, canned goods, and toiletries.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and seven children, for whom she and her husband work very hard to provide everything they need. Julia works selling makuti (palm fronds used for thatching) from her home. It is a very stable business and during peak seasons, especially the rainy seasons, it provides very good profits.

Julia is requesting a loan from Yehu with which she will have enough money to buy makuti for resale. She says that she currently has many orders, which she intends to fulfill before the heavy rains start.

loans.use: to buy makuti (palm fronds used for thatching) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Omar Isidro

texts.es: Omar Isidro de 39 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos de 16,9 anos de edad, de la localidad de León, lugar que esta ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. Él tiene por actividad económica el servicio de pintura  contratado  por las distintas empresas de la localidad .Tiene 15 anos de desempeñarse en el negocio. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener  un medio de trabajo para brindarles estabilidad económica a sus hijos. Omar Isidro ha demostrado su responsabilidad en los créditos anteriores los cuales han sido de mucha ayuda para seguir en el negocio y mantener su fuente de trabajo. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materiales como: pintura de aceite, rodos, escaleras, brochas, plástico negro, ciner. Omar Isidro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Omar Isidro is 39 years old, married, and has two children (ages 16 and 9). He is from the town of León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. Omar provides painting services as a contractor to different businesses in his town. He has 15 years of experience in this line of work.

Omar’s business was started out of necessity because he needed work so that he could provide financial stability for his children. He has demonstrated responsibility with his previous loans, since they have been very helpful in continuing his business and maintaining a source of income.

This needed loan will be invested as operating capital for purchasing materials such as oil-based paints, rollers, brushes, ladders, black plastic, and paint thinner. Omar Isidro is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy oil-based paints, rollers, brushes, ladders, black plastic, and paint thinner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa y a realizar la sastrería, vive con su esposo, sus hijos y nietos, ella y su esposo son los que trabajan por el hogar, su negocio lo constituye mediante la confección de ropa la cual vende, como calzonetas, vestidos de niñas, trabaja casi todos los días desde hace 10 años.
Solicita un préstamo para comprase por mayoreo la tela que es utilizada para confeccionar las prendas de vestir con las que comercializa, tambien materiales como ciper, botones, hilo, que le ayudaran a mantener  lo necesario para trabajar, se acercan la época de graduaciones para la cual tiene más demanda, la inversión le permitirá estar capacitada.
Los sueños de María son tener un ingreso mayor del negocio, en las fiestas de fin de año tener más comodidad.
texts.en:
María works selling clothes and doing tailoring.  She lives with her husband, children and grandchildren.  She and her husband are the ones that work for the home.  The business consists in selling clothes like shorts and girls’ dresses she makes.  She works almost every day and has been doing so for ten years.

She requests a loan to buy the fabric she uses at wholesale to make the clothes she sells.  She will also buy supplies like zippers, buttons and thread that will help her have what she needs to work.  Graduation season is approaching and demand rises so the investment will allow her to take advantage of it.  María’s dream is to earn higher income from the business during the end-of-year festivities and to have more comfort.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread.

loans.name: Abelizario

texts.es:
Abelizario, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos dependen de él, su esposa le ayuda con la venta de tortillas ha obtener ingresos para el hogar. Abelizario se dedica a la sastrería, atiende un molino y en la venta de gallinas, lo realiza todos los días desde hace 15 años.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas para confeccionar las prendas, tambien le dará mantenimiento al molino y comprara concentrado para las gallinas, esto le ayudara a que su negocio tenga estabilidad, invirtiendo en sus tres ocupaciones.
El quiere con el préstamo tener la facilidad de mejorar sus condiciones actúales.
texts.en:
Abelizario lives with his wife and children; all  are dependent ton him.  His wife helps him by selling tortillas to earn household income.  Abelizario works as a tailor, runs a mill and sells chickens.  He’s done this every day for the last 15 years.

He’s requesting a loan to buy fabric to make clothing and also to repair the mill and to buy chicken feed.  This will help his business attain stability by investing in all three occupations.  He hopes the loan will help him improve his current conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, repair the corn mill and to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María, vive con sus tres hijos, está soltera, tiene el apoyo de su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de carne y tambien a las labores agrícolas, estas actividades las aprendió con sus padres, tiene aproximadamente 15 años cultivando maíz.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, para realizar la siembra de temporada, además tambien comprar cerdos para el destazo; este crédito le ayudara para suministrar los insumos para la cosecha de maíz.
El objetivo de Maria es mejorar la producción y la venta de carne, tener una mejor situación económica para ayudar a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives with her three children and has a family that supports her. She works selling meat and doing farm work. She learned these trades from her parents and she has been growing corn for around 15 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy the compost and weedkiller she needs for the sewing season, and also to buy pigs to slaughter. This loan will help her to buy the necessary supplies for corn harvesting. 

Maria's aim is to increase her production and sales of meat, and to improve her economic situation so that she can support her three children.

loans.use: to buy compost, weedkiller, and pigs.

loans.name: Edy Marleny

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cerveza y tambien se sigue dedicando a la elaboracion de panes,la socia vende panes en la plaza desde las 8:00 a.m hsta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los panes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,azucar,leche y huevos para preparar panes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues selling beer and also baking bread.  She sells bread in the square from 8am until 5pm.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell the bread.  She requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, milk and eggs to make bread.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and beads.

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es: Alba Lorena de 42 anos de edad, del municipio del Sauce, casado con dos hijos de 19, 9 anos de edad los dos está estudiando. Alba tiene por actividad  económica la venta de ganado y leche, negocio que lo  tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace  22 anos que se desempeña en dicha actividad. El negocio lo aprendió de su papa, y con ayuda del esposo es que pudo salir adelante, para tener un medio de vida digno para sacar adelante a sus hijos. La rutina de Alba Lorena es salir 3 tres veces por semana a las comunidades aledañas a buscar ganado en pie para la compra y venta del mismo.  Y también vender leche en su casa de habitación en horas temprana de la mañana. El los créditos anteriores ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un  ganado que se lo están ofreciendo a buen precio. Alba Lorena agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a pequeños comerciantes de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Alba Lorena is 42 years old and from the town of El Sauce. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 9, who are studying. Alba sells cattle and milk. Her business is located at her home where she has been in operation for the past 22 years. She learned this trade from her father and now her husband helps with moving the business forward so that they can live a decent life and help their children get ahead.

Alba Lorena’s routine consists of traveling to the surrounding communities three times a week to buy live cattle and to also make sales. She also sells milk from her home during the early morning hours. With her previous loans, Alba demonstrated responsibility by paying on time and according to the terms.

The loan she is requesting will be invested as operating capital so that she can buy cattle being offered at a good price. Alba Lorena is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to small businesspeople from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elyor

texts.ru: Элёр трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Дети еще маленькие. Условия жизни у них  очень тяжелые. С ранних лет он работал на поле, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. Семье принадлежит участок земли площадью 5 га. Эльёр вместе с женой и родителями занимается выращиванием зерновых.  Уже более 10 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Его заботливая жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай он  продает местным жителям по более низкой цене, чем на базаре, с первых рук. Большая часть населения данного района приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельнице получают муку и выпекают хлеб для личного пользования. Элёр планирует купить скота для расширения бизнеса и таким образом получить больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Элёр ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Elyor is a hardworking man, he is married and is raising three children.  The children are still young.  Their living conditions are very difficult.  He has worked in the fields from an early age in order to earn money to support his family.  The family owns a 5 acre plot of land.  Together with his wife and parents Elyor grows grain crops.  He has been in this business for more then 10 years.  His caring wife helps him to run the business.  He sells the harvest directly to local residents for a lower price than at the market.  A large part of the population in this area purchases wheat, then grinds flour at the mill and bakes bread for personal use.  Elyor plans to buy livestock in order to grow his business and thereby increase his income.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni for the purchase of livestock.  Elyor is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to completely soundproof her studio.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria vhanchos y gallinas,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender lso animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chanchos y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Eliana continues working in the animal-raising business. She raises pigs and hens which she fattens and then sells in various markets. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., and has been working in this trade for 6 years. Her dream is to have her own premises and sell her animals from there. Eliana is requesting a loan to buy pigs, hens, and animal feed. She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs, hens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Najma, 43 years old, is an active lady who lives with her husband, two sons and three daughters in the city of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a taxi driver, while their elder son is an electrician. Her elder daughter is getting married soon and Najma is worried, as she has insufficient savings to meet her wedding expenses.

Because of her husband’s limited earning power, three years ago Najma began stitching at home for the people who live in her neighbourhood. She serves her community well and has become famous for providing good-quality service.

Her earnings, unfortunately, have been interrupted because her stitching machine is no longer functioning. As a member of a six-person lending group, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new stitching machine for her tailoring business. This will help her to increase savings and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine for her small tailoring business.

loans.name: Mark John

texts.en:
Mark John is a 26-year-old man and a father of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for more than 2 years now. He transports passengers and small amounts of cargo from one place to another.

Mark John is asking for a loan to buy fuel for his motorcycle and pay for his children's school fees.

In the future, Mark John hopes to make his business a success. He also wants to explore other ventures to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle fuel and pay for his children's school fees.

loans.name: Teko Pora Group

texts.es:
Teko Pora tiene 15 miembros, donde todas se han unido con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias. Son mujeres muy laboriosas que siempre han trabajado y quieren seguir haciéndolo por sus hijos.
La Sra. Marcela, presidenta del grupo, tiene su despensa hace ya un buen tiempo. Tiene un negocio bien surtido y eso le ayuda a poder tener muy buena clientela siempre. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y trabajando y así ser una gran microempresaria.
Marcela solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, cárnicos, panificados, frutas y verduras, con los que va a tener mejor surtido su negocio y así seguir dando una buena variedad como siempre a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teko Pora has 15 members, who have come together with the aim of helping their families. They are very hard-working women who have always worked, and want to continue to work for their children. 

Señora Marcela, who is leader of the group, has owned her shop for a long time now. She has a well-stocked business and this always helps her to maintain a very good customer base. Her aim is to be able to continue growing and working, and in doing so become a great micro-entrepreneur. 

Marcela is requesting this loan in order to buy drinks, meat and dairy products, baked goods, fruits, and vegetables, so that her shop is better stocked and she can continue to offer as wide a variety as ever to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat and dairy products, baked goods, fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Basilio
