texts.es: El Sr. Basilio tiene 30 años casado con cinco hijos de las edades de 11, 9, 7, 4 y 2 años, el  se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz y maní en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de  Belén,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Basilio va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maní y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Basilio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Basilio, 30, is married and has five children who are 11, 9, 7, 4 and 2 years of age.  He works in agriculture growing a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes, manioc, corn and peanuts.  His parcel is located in the community of Belén.  This loan is his fourth sequence in the institution and Basilio will use it to prepare the soil for his peanut crop.  The reason for requesting the loan is to have resources for planting and to be able to subsist.  The business challenge Basilio faces is weather extremes that sometimes ruin crops.  He will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life because he’s responsible for all household expenses.  He’s a responsible, hardworking man who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es:
Teobaldo de 46 años, convive con Vaceliza con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero vive con 4 de ellos. Ellos viven en una casa propia que Teobaldo construyó en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Teobaldo es un hombre de principios y valores. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 18 años. En todo este tiempo consolidó unos terrenos donde produce café, yucas, frutas cítricas. Pero menciona que el agrada producir más café, porque el precio de venta es mayor y la demanda también le favorece.
“Tengo como 4 hectáreas de terrenos que la comunidad me dio, por eso la mayor parte del día la paso en mis parcelas”, menciona.
El principal problema que tiene es la falta de capital para adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico, semillas y para el pago al personal que contrata para estas labores.
Anhela ser uno de los productores cuya cosecha sea negociada en otras ciudades, es decir un vendedor mayorista, por ello se esmera en aumentar su producción y terrenos. Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Al igual que en los préstamos anteriores se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, donde es un socio activo y responsable.
Invertirá los 1000 soles en el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos, además comprará bolsas de abono orgánico como guano de ave de corral.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is 46 years old. He lives with the mother of his five children and four of those children. The family lives in its own house that Teobaldo build in his native community near the central jungle region. Teobaldo is a man of principles and values. For the 18 years, he has made a living in agriculture. He has consolidated various plots of land on which he produces coffee, yuca (a potato-like food), and citric fruits. He would like to grow more coffee because it has a high demand and market price. However, he is not yet able to expand his coffee crop, “I have about four hectares of land that the community gave me, so I spend most of the day on those plots,” says Teobaldo.

The main problem Teobaldo identifies is a lack of capital to buy bags of organic fertilizer, seeds, and to pay the wages of contracted laborers to help with the work. He would like to become a wholesaler whose products are bought in other cities, therefore Teobaldo strives to increase his land plots and production. 

This is Teobaldo's seventh loan with MFP. Just like with his previous loans, he pledges to make his monthly repayments on time. He is an active and responsible member of the communal bank "Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi." Teobaldo will invest the 1000 soles in the wages of contracted labor to help collect his crops, as well as to buy bags of organic fertilizer, such as guano (bird droppings).

loans.use: to hire day labor and to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 51, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She together, with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eden hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a very dedicated woman who is always on the lookout for opportunities. She is happy to have achieved some of her goals. Amina has been farming for several years. Recently, she has had a retail shop which sells to the neighborhood. She rents her store, but she says that it is not spacious enough for expansion. She wants to rent a bigger store in which she will stock more merchandise to sell. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to enable her to rent a bigger store. She is sure to have more sales.

loans.use: to rent a bigger store.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is from Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Antonina is married and has four children. To make a living, Antonina cultivates bananas and coconuts to sell. Antonina has been in this business for 10 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. Antonina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Antonina joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cherriemy

texts.en:
For over five years in Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Cherriemy, a 51-year-old married mother of 2 children, has made a with her general store , where she sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Recently, Cherriemy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, and other items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, and other items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She has been involved in selling shoes for four years, working seven days a week. She also gets additional income from agriculture and animal rearing.

She has requested a loan of USHS 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more shoes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her businesses. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charge on loans. She stays in her husband's house, which has access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni de 38 años, esta casada con Constantin de 49 años, producto de un calido hogar tienen dos hijos, Omar de 11 años y Karen de 20. Juntos habitan en una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Con el entusiasmo de trabajar y salir adelante inicio su propio negocio, que consiste en la venta de lubricantes y otros para vehículos de todas las marcas, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 8 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de combustible pero al notar que el consumo de gas natural vehicular inicio su expansión en nuestro país orientó su camino hacia este negocio generándole buenas ganancias. Desempeña su labor conjuntamente con su esposo Constantin quien ha sido desde siempre una gran ayuda y cuya presencia es permanente permitiéndole a ella desempeñar las gestiones correspondientes.
Como parte de la compra comercial al por mayor que realizan cada cierto periodo se presentó una oferta especial por parte de sus proveedores mayoristas consistente en la distribución de 100 cajas de aceite  lubricante a un precio módico, ocasión que como comerciante no puede desaprovechar ya que gracias a ello logrará mantener su negocio abastecido por un periodo prolongado.
Como parte del crecimiento desea a futuro aperturar otra tienda dedicada a la venta y distribución de llantas para todo tipo de vehículos, pues tiene la plena seguridad que con trabajo y esfuerzo será posible lograrlo. Tiene un limpio historial de crédito, siendo este su préstamo número 19. Es integrante de la junta directiva de su banco comunal  desempeñando su labor de manera firme ya que considera a su grupo muy unido y con amplia responsabilidad de pago.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado a la compra de una oferta consistente en 1000 cajas de aceite lubricante para vehículos diversos.
texts.en:
Marleni is 38 years old and married to Constantin, age 49. Their loving household also includes their two children, Omar (age 11) and Karen (age 20). They all live in a home that is made of solid materials. With the drive to work and move forward, Marleni started her own business. She sells lubricants and other auto supplies of all brands. Marleni has been in business for the past eight years. She previously sold fuel, but she states that the use of natural gas for vehicles was just starting to expand throughout the country. This opened the door for a business that could generate good earnings. She shares the duties with her husband Constantin, who has always been a great help and a permanent fixture in assisting her with making the necessary arrangements.

A commercial wholesaler is currently in the middle of a promotion that is being offered to its customers. Those who purchase 100 cases of motor oil will receive a reduced price. Marleni does not want to miss out on this opportunity since it will help to maintain her business and keep it stocked for a prolonged length of time.

As part of her future growth, Marleni wants to open another shop that is dedicated to selling and delivering tires for all types of vehicles. She is very confident that she can achieve this goal through hard work and effort. Marleni has a clean credit history and will be receiving her 19th loan. She is a member of the Board of Directors for her Communal Bank. Marleni and the other Board members work together as a close-knit group and have great responsibilities with handling the payments.

With this loan of 2,000 PEN, Marleni will be able to complement her existing capital so that she can buy 1,000 cases of lubricants for different types of vehicles.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 cases of vehicle lubricants.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is 45 years old, widowed, and lives with her five children. She has a store where she sells basic household necessities, such as beans, rice, bread, instant products, soap and other items.

She has several years with the business, and that has given her valuable experience in sales, which allows her to obtain better earnings. The business is located in her home and is very well known. She has a large clientele, as people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality and affordable. In addition to the unequaled service, she is always at the service of her customers.

Mwanamvua is an energetic, hard-working woman with many goals for the future. She is ready to do her very best, as she knows that only in this way will she be able to fulfill her dreams and achieve success.

As every good business person does, she wants to see her business grow and also wants to undertake new investments; however, she doesn't have sufficient working capital, and that is why she is applying to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, bread, candy, instant products, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, bread, candy, instant products, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du  groupe ADONAÏM 2.  Zenabo se porte très bien et a décidé de ceder sa place de représentante du groupe à Bintou.  Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a trois (03) personnes  en charge.

Mme vend des combustibles (bois de chauffe)  depuis 03ans. Elle se fait livrer à domicile. Ses clients sont les voisines.

Elle veut s’acheter un demi-camion de bois de chauffe.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne acheter une moto et aider son mari pour la scolarisation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Ms. BINTOU is the official of the group ADONAÏM 2.  Zenabo is well and has decided to give up her spot as the group's representative to Bintou, who is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 4. Two are going to school. And she has three persons to support. 

Bintou has been selling fuel (firewood) for three years. Deliveries are made to her home. Her customers are her neighbors. 

She wants to purchase a half truckload of firewood.

She is saving her profits. Her ambition is to purchase a motorbike and to help out her husband in covering her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase a half truckload of firewood

loans.name: Soumaïla

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Soumaïla a 36 ans, marié et père de quatre enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou II Extension un des quartiers populaires de la ville  de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Soumaïla après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  il y a douze ans aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il vend ses articles : Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Après avoir correctement remboursé les 2 prêts précédents, il est à son troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 sacs du sucre, 12 cartons du thé, 10 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing-gum, 12 paquets d’allumettes et 8 cartons de savon. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Soumaïla is 36 years of age, married, and a father to four children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou, an extension to one of the popular neighborhoods of the village of Sikasso (the third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

After many unsuccessful businesses, 12 years ago Soumaïla started working selling miscellaneous articles, and has a store in front of his family home where he sells his items: cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, and so on. He is much sought-after by his customers, due to the quality of the products he sells. To satisfy his ever-growing customer base, Soumaïla decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about a year ago. After successfully repaying his two earlier loans, he is now on his third. This loan will allow him to buy 15 packs of varied cigarettes, five bags of sugar, 12 boxes of tea, 10 packs of candies, 10 packs of chewing gum, 12 packets of matches and eight boxes of soap.  He buys his merchandise from wholesale traders in the city, before reselling them in his store. 
 
With this loan he plans to make a monthly profit of 175,000 francs CFA, which will mainly be used to increase his working capital, contribute to covering the household expenses, and pay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy various store items.

loans.name: Sugey Marina

texts.es: Sugey con su previo credikiva compró calzado, cosméticos, productos de platería y ropa, todo esto respondiendo a pedidos solicitados por sus clientes en su tarea de preventa. Con ello se benefició mucho, porque obtuvo mayor liquidez, incrementó sus ventas y las utilidades de su negocio. Su inversión del credikiva, al que en la actualidad aplica, es en mercancía con la que viene trabajando, pues la conoce muy bien y sabe donde encontrar los mejores precios, con los cuales atraer a su clientela. Ella comprará ropa, calzado accesorios femeninos, cosméticos artículos de plata, con lo que vestirá a su clientela, para que estos alegres reciban las navidades y el año nuevo.
texts.en:
Sugey's previous microloan was used to buy footwear, cosmetics, silver items, and clothing, all of which were items previously ordered by her customers in her business of sales of catalog goods.  With this loan, she benefited greatly by increasing her liquidity.  She increased her sales and the profits of her business.  

Her investment of the microloan that she is currently applying for will be in the good that she has continued to sell, since she has a lot of knowledge of these goods and where to find the best prices, with which she can better attract customers.  She will buy clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, and silver jewelry to deck out her customers so that they can have a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year's.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, feminine accessories, cosmetics, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: El Sr. Demetrio tiene 46 años, casado tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años, el  se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es chapista hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la zona de Cota Cota al sur de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Demetrio  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas y materiales y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Demetrio va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, Demetrio  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única  actividad que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Demetrio is 46 years old. He is married and has four children, ages 16, 14, 12, and 10. He works repairing cars. He has done body work for a number of years. His workshop is located in the Cota Cota zone in the south of the city of La Paz, where he offers his services. This loan is his second one with this institution. Sr.Demetrio is going to use this loan to purchase tools and materials and thus offer better service to his customers and increase his earnings. His reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving in his work. Sr. Demetrio is going to use the earnings to continue buying tools to continue outfitting his workshop. Demetrio is a very hard-working person. He feels happy about the opportunity offered [by the loan], since this is the only activity he has to support his family.

loans.use: to buy tools and material for car repairs

loans.name: Safora

texts.fr:
Madame Safora a 29 ans, marie et mère de 2 enfants, elle réside chez son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Madame Safora est gestionnaire de formation,  qui après ses études s’est vite initiée à la coiffure féminine depuis maintenant trois années. Avec une telle expérience dans un domaine, elle est très sollicitée par des jeunes demoiselles surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, anniversaire, etc.). L’insuffisance des ressources propres  pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de cette demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir acheter, 20 paquets de mèches de différentes qualités, 30 boites de gels et une douzaine de vernis de couleurs différentes à Bamako. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce deuxième prêt, un bénéfice moyen 100.000 FCFA lui permettant de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Safora is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She resides at her husband place in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts of Sikasso City. Ms. Safora is an administrator by training. After her studies, she soon became familiar with styling women's hair three years ago. With such experience in this domain, she is much in demand by young single women, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, anniversaries, etc.) 

Having insufficient resources of her own for carrying out her work is the reason for her goal and the justification for this request for a Soro Yiriwaso loan, so as to do better satisfying the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She is requesting this initial loan to increase her working capital to be able to purchase 20 packets of hair extensions of different qualities, 30 containers of gel, and a dozen of fingernail polish of different colors, in Bamako.

With this loan, she envisions making an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA enabling her to address most of her costs, help cover family expenses, pay the loan interest, and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase packets of hair extensions, gels, and fingernail polish

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice est camerounais de 36 marié et père de 04 enfants. Il a ouvert et gère un mini atelier de soudure depuis près de 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Grâce à sa technicité et son dynamisme, il a su fidéliser une clientèle de plus en plus exigeante. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de matières premieres (fers,plaques métalliques...) et de matériels (scie, pinces...) pour satisfaire à temps ces clients. Il souhaiterai réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et injecter une autre partie dans les besoins (nutrition et éducation) de sa famille.
texts.en: Patrice is a 36 year old Cameroonian. He is married and the father of four children. He opened and has managed a mini welding studio for nearly three years in an area of the city. Thanks to his technical nature and his dynamism, he knew how to make his customers faithful and increasingly demanding. This loan will allow him to increase his stock of raw materials (iron, metallic plaques) and materials (saw, pliers) to satisfy his customers on time. He wishes to reinvest his profits in his business in order to grow it and use another part of his profits for the nutritional and educational needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy iron, metallic plaques, a saw and pliers.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.fr: Celestine est une camerounaise de 41 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants dont les ages sont 7 et 6 ans. elle possède une mini boutique où elle vend des vetements depuis 2 ans dans un coin de la ville. Grâce à sa determination et à son dynamisme, elle a su fidéliser une bonne partie de son voisnage et augmenter graduellement cette clientèle au point où elle ressent le besoin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. ce credit lui permettra de renforcer son stock avec des vetements tels que l'afritude, les gants, les vetements pour femme et hommes etc...les bénéfices ainsi réalisés seront reinvestis dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et affectés dans l'assouvissement des besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Celestine is a 41 year old Cameroonian. She is a single mother of two children, aged 6 and 7 years. She has a mini store where she has sold clothing for two years in an area of the city. Thanks to her determination and dynamism, she knew how to make a good number of her neighbors into faithful customers and gradually increased her customer base to the point where she feels the need to increase her merchandise stock. This loan will allow her to reinforce her stock with clothing such as Afritude brand clothing, gloves, clothing for women and men, etc. The profits thus made will be reinvested in her business in order to grow it and used to satisfy her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her store.

loans.name: Chicas Lindas Group

texts.es:
El comité Chicas Lindas son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo, son 14 integrantes, todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras, se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problemita del grupo,  ayudan a su comunidad siempre y entre ellas también todas para que así puedan salir adelante juntas.
La Presidenta, la Sra.  Justina por ejemplo es una persona muy trabajadora, que por medio de la venta de cosméticos está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia con todo lo que puede y tiene a su alcance. Ella solicito de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos de todo tipo, y de esa forma seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Chicas Lindas” (Beautiful Girls) has 14 members who are all from the District of San Lorenzo. They are responsible and hardworking mothers who always come together whenever they need to resolve problems in their group or find opportunities to help their community. In addition, they want to move forward together.

The group president, Sra. Justina, is an example of a hardworking individual. Through her business of selling cosmetics, she has been able to move forward and help her family. She now has everything she needs at her disposal. Justina is requesting a loan so that she can buy cosmetics of all types. This will enable her to continue providing a wide variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Senovia

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny se dedica a la elaboración de tarjetas  para distintas fechas especiales, como para el día de la madre el día del amor del estudiante del Padre, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo en la elaboracion de sus tarjetas, en esta ocacion  la Sra. Jenny solicita este credito para la compra de material como cartulinas y goma eva para la elaboracion de tarjetas navideñas ya que se acerca esta epoca donde tiene mucha demanda, y tiene muchos pedidos que entregar.
texts.en: Jenny works making cards for various special holidays, like Mother's Day, Student's Day, and Father's Day.  She says that everything went well with her previous loan that she used for making her cards.  On this occasion, Jenny is requesting a loan to buy material, like pasteboard and decorative foam paper for making Christmas cards; this Christmas season is coming up and there is always a lot demand and she has many orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy materials, like pasteboard and decorative foam paper.

loans.name: Magali

texts.en: Magali is a single mother of a six-year-old boy with special needs. She came from the Dominican Republic seven years ago with a clear goal of becoming a productive citizen. Her son started the Early Intervention Program at the age of two, so she needed to work in something that allowed her to be at home caring for her son.  She has always been passionate about education and knew that she wanted to do something in that field, so she decided to open a home-based daycare service. She was able to procure all the necessary licenses and the business has been in service for three years now. She currently cares for 17 kids and employs two women who help her care for the children. Magali looks after her business with passion and dedication because she wants to give the children the same quality care that she gives her own child.  Magali is also studying part-time at a local community college in the Bronx, majoring in Early Childhood Education. Her goal is to finish her studies and open a full service day care center. Magali is asking for a loan to help her buy new material and equipment for her home-based business, which will increase the quality of the service she offers. Some of the things she needs are a desktop computer to help school-age children with their homework and for her to be able to do the daily menu online; new tables, chairs and beds.

loans.use: to buy a computer, tables, chairs and beds for her day care center

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for five years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to be able to buy a full truck of charcoal instead of contributing with other retailers and to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, él se dedica a administrar un chalet y un taller de mecanica automotriz, estos negocios los inicio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos, los horarios de atención son de 6:00am a 7:00pm, en el chalet su esposa le ayuda a atender los clientes.
Él quiere invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para poder fortalecer de mercadería el negocio, boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, y mas mercadería que es necesaria para que el negocio se encuentre con mas capacidad, esto le permitirá tener un mejor negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Su aspiración con el negocio es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife, but they have no children. He manages a sales kiosk and an auto repair shop. These businesses were started out of necessity so that he would have a source of income. His hours of operation are from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. At the sales kiosk, his wife helps with attending to the customers.

Luis wants to invest in his business, so he is requesting a loan to strengthen his inventory. He will buy snack foods, cookies, sodas, juices, and other items that he needs for his business so that it will have more capacity. This will result in an improvement in his business and an increase of his sales. His wish is that his business will result in a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, cookies, sodas, juices, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
María, quiere incrementar el negocio en el numero de cerdos, tambien mejorar la infraestructura, ella se comprara materiales de construcción como bloques, laminas, cemento, madera, para la construcción de una galera donde puedan estar los cerdos.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue bueno, compro cerdos y ahora tiene en cuenta 12 en total para engorde, esto ha mejorado sus ingresos  para los gastos familiares.
texts.en: María wants to buy more pigs for her business and remodel the farm buildings. She wil buy construction materials like cement blocks, sheet steel, cement, and wood for the pig pen. Her previous loan was a success; she bought pigs and now has 12 to fatten so that she can earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sheet steel, cement, and wood for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, necesita realizar un nuevo préstamo, ya que continua vendiendo tortillas y  se comprara nuevamente los productos que utiliza como maíz y leña, con los fondos prestados logra mantener su negocio por un tiempo.
Su efecto con el préstamo anterior en el negocio, manifiesta que le permitió tener mas capacidad para atender la clientela, sus ingresos han ido superándose, gracias a la inversión ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en: Juana needs another loan because she is still selling tortillas and has to buy more supplies like corn and wood. With the loan, she will be able to keep her business going for a while. Her previous loan allowed her to serve more customers, to increase her income, and to improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood.

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en: Daylin is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Daylin is married and has five children. To make a living, she sells fish while her husband does fishing. She has been in her business for five years and earns PHP 2,000 a month from these activities. This year, Daylin joined GDMPC. Daylin is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000, which will be used to repair her husband's fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and other materials for making jackets

loans.name: Mani Fane

texts.fr:
Madame Mani est âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Mani après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité  d’achat et vente des pagnes wax, et des articles en plastiques (Seaux bole gobelet etc) depuis plus de trois ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo (Burkina Faso), avant de les revendre de façon ambulantes dans son quartier, au grand marché et au marché de Médine à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an. Elle est à son troisième prêt individuel  les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce troisième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 4 douzaines de baignoires  et 10 douzaine de seaux.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Mani is 55 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She resides with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City. After having run many businesses without success, Ms. Mani became familiar with this business of buying and selling Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and plasticware (buckets, basins, cups, etc.) over three years ago. She purchases her goods in Bobo (Burkina Faso) and then resells them door to door in her district, at the big market, and at the Médine market. Her customer base is composed essentially of housekeepers. She is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her goods. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso over a year ago. She is now on her third individual loan. The two previous loans were correctly repaid. 

This third individual loan will enable her to purchase 15 lengths of Wax 'pagne', 4 dozen basins, and 10 dozen buckets. 

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and to pay the loan interest, and the rest will be invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth and plasticware

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de moda y confección desde hace 50 años, confecciona específicamente buzos (para colegios), faldas, poleras, blusas, vestidos de novia y vestidos de gala, trabaja en conjunto con su hija, habilitó un parte de su casa como taller y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos  que  va necesitando como géneros, telas polar, accesorios varios para las costuras y confección lo encuentra  en la cuidad de Santiago donde encuentra todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará elásticos, agujas, géneros, tela polar, pique, blonda.
Una de las metas de Maria es tener un bazar en su casa, donde pueda incluir otro tipo de mercadería y a la vez realizando sus costuras y confecciones, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y darle un buen pasar a la familia.
Maria vive junto a su hija, quien trabaja con ella en las costuras y confecciones. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un bazar donde atienda a su clientela de forma más tranquila y vender otros productos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza
texts.en:
Maria is part of the Communal Bank “Mis Sueños” (My Dreams) belonging to the city of Talca. 

She has worked in fashion and dressmaking for 50 years. She mostly makes tracksuits (for schools), skirts, t-shirts, blouses, wedding dresses and formal dress. She works with her daughter. She converted part of her house into a workshop and she works the hours that she has available. 

The goods and supplies that she needs, such as fabric, fleece, and various accessories for sewing and dressmaking, can be found in the city of Santiago, where everything can be found for a low cost, which is therefore economically convenient.

With the loan she will buy elastic, needles, fabric, fleece, pique fabric and lace.

One of Maria's goals is to have a small shop in her house, where she can include other types of goods and simultaneously carry out her sewing and dressmaking, and so generate more income and provide well for her family.  Maria lives with her daughter, who works with her in sewing and dressmaking. She dreams of having a shop where she can serve her clients in a calmer way and sell other products. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her, as it has allowed her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable with the company of the other enterprising women of the Banco Comunal group, as they share different activities and interests. With respect to the training imparted in the meeting, she has learnt to manage her business in a better way. 

Talca belongs to the Maule region, located in the central zone of the country. It constitutes the administrative, economic and cultural centre of the region, being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley. 

There is a strange saying about Talca in Chile, "Talca, Paris, London". Some say that this saying derives from something originally said by an English person, "Talca is like London" because of the abundant mist that frequently covers the city in winter.

loans.use: to buy elastic, needles, fabric, fleece, pique fabric and lace

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea  ella es Viuda tiene 66 años y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo e esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de librería, venta de artesania, venta de ropa, juegos en línea, trabajando en empresas privadas.

La persona que sale en la foto adjunta es socia que pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO". This bank is located in the Cusco area in the province of Cusco, which is in the Cusco region.

The member requesting the loan is Andrea. She is a widow. She is 66 years old and has 8 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store. She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, sweets and soft drinks, etc. She has been operating this business for many years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. She works in her business Monday to Sunday, from 06:00am to 09:00pm approximately, although this schedule may change depending on what is going on during the day. This member is a responsible and hardworking person. In this way she can make a better life for her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy stock, such as rice and milk, for her business. 

The other members have a book selling business, sell craftwork, sell clothes, online games, and work in private companies. 

The woman in the smaller photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work commitments. 

The member is grateful to those who are sharing her dream in this way. She is committed to making the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as rice and milk, for her business

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
Wilian, está solicitando un préstamo para mantener su negocio ya que es su fuente de ingresos, él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos de un día de nacidos y concentrado para alimentarlos, esto le ayudara a mejorar la granja.
Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior tuvo una buena experiencia, obtuvo trabajo para poder solventar sus necesidades económicas, hasta el momento se ha mantenido estable, ya que el negocio sirve de subsistencia.
texts.en:
Wilian is asking for a loan to maintain his business, since it is his source of income.  He is asking for this loan to buy one day old chicks and concentrated feed to give to them.  This will help him to make his farm better.

He says that with his prior loan, he had a very good experience.  He found work to cover his economic needs, and up to this moment he has remained stable, since his business serves to sustain him.

loans.use: to buy newborn chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Dinamarca - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento DINAMARCA – 26  está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales cinco son mujeres y tres varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Jenny ella es muy joven ya que tiene 19 años,  se dedica a la  venta de verduras y frutas en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es el tercero dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jenny va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de un puetso de venta ya que el que tiene es alquilado y tambien para la compra de verdura y fruta de temporada  por mayor para surtir su puesto  de venta,  la Sra. Jenny  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es el tener que levantarse temprano para comprar sus verduras y frutas ya que ella va a comprar de los camiones que llegan de los distintos valles que proveen estos productos a la ciudad y otro de sus retos es también la competencia que tiene pero ella trabaja duro muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando verduras para su negocio, se siente feliz ya gradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan a ella y a sus compañeros de grupo ya que la mayoría es gente joven y emprendedora.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurs' Bank "DINAMARCA – 26" is made up of eight members, which includes five women and three men who all are involved in different types of businesses.  The president of the bank is named Jenny, and she is very young, since she is only 19 years old.  She works selling fruits nad vegetables at her place of business, which is located in the zone of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  This loan will be her third with the institution.

Jenny will use this loan to buy a place of business, since the place she currently has is a rental, and also to buy fruits and vegetables that are in season in bulk to stock her sales point.  Jenny has faced challenges in her business, like having to get up very early to buy the fruits and vegetables because she buys them from the trucks that arrive from the different valleys that provide these products to the city.  Another of her hardships is the competition that she faces, but she works very very hard to improve her quality of life.  She will use the benefits of this to continue buying vegetables for the business, and she feels happy and thankful for the opportunity given to her and to her compatriots in this group, and notes that the majority of them are young and entrepreneurial people.

loans.use: to buy a location to sell vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, realiza una nueva siembra, necesita dinero para invertir en la agricultura comprándose 4 sacos de abono y herbicida granulado, esta nueva compra  se debe a que él quiere realizar una siembra de la temporada.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que aumento la productividad de los granos básicos y tambien sus ingresos, mejorando sus condiciones económicas en la familia.
texts.en: Juan is starting to plant and needs to invest in the farm by buying four sacks of fertilizer and granulated weed killer for the new season. His previous loan helped him increase his basic grain production and his income while improving his family´s finances.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer and granulated weed killer.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn, 29, is married with three dependent children, one of whom is still in school. She lives in a rural area of Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Rice farming and vegetables planting have been her main sources of income for three years. The current business earns her approximately US $6 per day to meet her family's needs. 

Sophorn's group, of which she is the leader, consists of two members who live in the same village. She is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 160,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy materials to build a decent latrine such as a latrine bowl, tile draining etc. Sophorn hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Nang, age 55, is a rice farmer. She is a villager in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province, Cambodia, where she lives with her husband and their one child. She and her husband have operated their rice farming business for almost 30 years. Their current business earns them about US $3 per day.

Nang has been with VisionFund for nine cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. The other member of the loan group has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Nang has used the previous loans wisely in order to better support her family's living conditions. At this time, she and the other group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 160,000 KHR each. Nang is the leader of the loan group. 

Nang intends to use her portion of the loan funds to buy materials for building a proper latrine for her family's use, including a latrine bowl, sewage draining materials, and tile. Nang is pleased that this loan will help her improve her family's health and well-being in this way.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a latrine for her family

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a 52-year-old, married woman who has seven children. She lives in Poblacion, Plaridel. Editha been in her business of raising pigs for 10 years, and she gets an income of 3,500 PHP per month. Editha became a member of GDMPC this year. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha, 32, lives with her life companion and four young, dependent children. She has a store where she sells basic staples, basic grains, bread, milk and soap, among other items. She’s been in business for three years, and it’s always had good results. It’s located in a very strategic spot, and she’s acquired a large clientele that prefers her because she always has what they need: good quality products at accessible prices with excellent service besides. 

Mwanasha is a very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and is always on the lookout for new opportunities to prove to herself that she can reach success working hard and with dedication. Demand has increased, and she needs to invest in more products to not disappoint her customers, which is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy basic grains, bread, snacks, instant products, soap,flour, etc. She feels happy with the support and is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, snacks, instant products, soap, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and raise pigs.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animles vomo pollos,la socia los hece engordar y crecer y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados ,la socia cria como 200 pollos y en este negocio ya tiene 8 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda vender los pollos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Olinda is still raising animals such as chickens, which she fattens and raises to sell at makets and fairs. She has raised 200 pigs since she started her business eight years ago, and things are going well. Her dream is to have a larger space where she can sell chickens. She is applying for the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
This is Loida. She previously received a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of goods to resell in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, of 20,000 PHP, to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Loida hopes to have a good life with her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items and products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Omm Santi Group

texts.en:
In 2008, four women from Tukla village located in the Khariar block of Nuapada district, one of the poorest districts of India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named Omm Santi to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business. Purnimadei is the one standing second from the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, 27 and 25 years of age, who help in her business. Purnimadei hails from a traditional cloth weaving community. For the last 40 years, she has been running a cloth weaving business with her husband. Now she has two hand looms for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from trader in a village that is 20 km away. They prepare 80 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees. Purnimadei does the initial processing of the yarn to make it ready for weaving and after that, her husband and sons fit it to the hand loom and weave the sari. They only weave saris because of the demand in the market. Her family works around 8-10 hours a day and weaves one piece of sari from each hand loom. Purnimadei sells her products to the local traders on a weekly basis. She earns a monthly income of Rs.6,000, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. With the loan, she wants to buy a thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing & transportation costs of the raw materials. Purnimadei wishes to grow her business and save enough to complete the construction of her half-constructed house.

Santidei, Padmabati and Somatuladei are the other members of the group and they also have cloth weaving businesses.

loans.use: To purchase thread/yarn in bulk

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from Poblacion, Baliangao. She is 57 years old. Erlinda is married and has nine children. To make a living, she does fish vending while her husband does fishing. She has been engaged in her business for 30 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. This year, Erlinda joined GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 23, is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years, producing maize and milk. He sells these to the people in his local area.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy and insure a dairy cow. The money gained from this cow will uplift his family's standard of living and pay for his children's school fees. In the future, he plans to have four dairy cows, allowing his farm to produce more milk and bring more income to the family over the next five years.

Lack of sufficient rainfall, leading to food shortage, is his major challenge in farming.

John is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for providing this loan.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and has four children. She used her previous loan to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics. Her boutique did very well, and she successfully repaid her loan.

She is requesting a new loan of 106,600 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy clothes, blankets, sheets and shoes. She hopes to have a big boutique and to own a supermarket someday.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy de 30 años es una madre soltera. Tiene un hijo de 9 años a quien cuida con amor. Ellos viven en una casa de material rústico pero de su propiedad. Lucy es una madre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo es por el bienestar de su familia, en especial de su pequeño hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura con el sembrío de café. “tengo 3 parcelas de terrenos donde cultivo solo café”, menciona. Además varía su producción con el cultivo de yucas, plátanos y algo de cítricos. La inversión que realiza en cada siembra, le permite adquirir semillas y bolsas de abono orgánico, pero admite que sus cultivos fueron aumentando poco a poco de acuerdo a sus ganancias. Ella considera que el principal problema es la falta de capital para tener mayor producción, pero lo hace paulatinamente.
Estos meses se va esforzando en los cuidados de su cafetal, con la limpieza y con fertilizantes que esparce, pero no es suficiente, por ello solicita de su apoyo. 
Una de sus metas es ser una agricultora mayorista, para ello trabaja con dedicación. Éste es su préstamo número 4 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad, como en los créditos anteriores. “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente a gusto trabajando con socios responsables. Con el dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café y una parte para las yucas.
texts.en:
Lucy is 30 years old and a single mother.  She has one child who is 9 years old, who she cares for lovingly.  The live in a house made of rustic material, but it is her own.  Lucy is an exemplary mother.  All of her efforts are for the good of her family, especially for her young son.  She is involved in agriculture and grows coffee.  "I have three pieces of land where I just grow coffee," she said.  

In addition, she varies her production with the cultivation of yucca, plantains, and citrus.  The resulting profit from each planting is enough to acquire seeds and organic fertilizers, and she says that her crops have been larger and larger because of her increasing profits.  She says that the primary problem is the lack of working capital to have better production, but she is doing it slowly.

These months are the time when she is busiest working on her coffee care, cleaning and trimming, and spreading fertilizers, but what she can do is not enough, and therefore, she is asking for your support.

One of her goals is to become a large scale agriculturalist, for which she works with dedication.  This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She promises to pay her loan back punctually, just as with her previous loans.  “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” is the name of her communal banking group, and she feels happy to work with these responsible group members.  With this money, she will be able to acquire bags of organic fertilizers for her coffee crops and some for the yucca as well.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 59 years old, married and has four children. He owns a butcher shop and has been in business for the last twelve years. He is very hard-working, because he has to provide for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has grown, and his business has expanded. He also earns an income from farming.

He wishes to open up more businesses in other locations. He requests a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy more meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in the butcher shop.

loans.name: Nzambi

texts.en:
Nzambi is 41 years old, married and has three children. She is a tailor and has been in this business for five years. She also earns an income from farming. Her business has been doing well and she has expanded her business since she became a client of Faulu Kenya.

She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She requests a loan of 10,935 KES to buy more fabric for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita hopes to be financially stable. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to study God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, age 51, is a food vendor. She earns an income by preparing home-cooked food and selling it to people in her neighborhood. She and her husband have six children and live in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as fisherman, and Anecita helps him sell his catch at the market.
 
Anecita is asking for a loan in order to buy ingredients such as meat and vegetables for her cooking business, as well as kitchen utensils. With this investment, she will be able to able to sell more home-cooked food to her customers, thus increasing her income and improving her family's standard of living. 

Anecita's goal is to better support her family and to save money toward the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and kitchen utensils for her cooking business

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis earns an income by operating a taxi service. He is an Egyptian man from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of Albania. He and his wife have a seven-year-old child and a one-year-old baby. The family lives in the southeastern part of the country.
 
Even though Elvis has been fully integrated in society in some ways, he still lives in his own community and “loves to serve his own people the most,” he says laughing, because they are the most vulnerable, according to him. He has been offering taxi transportation services to and from his city for some time and his work has kept him increasingly busy. He thanks God for all the good things offered to him because, despite being the sole provider for his family, he has been able to supply them with necessities, he says.

The loan Elvis is requesting will allow him to take his taxi vehicle to the auto shop for repairs. He will immediately begin operating his vehicle again once the repairs are made.

loans.use: to take his taxi vehicle to the auto shop for essential repairs

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Andrés, solicita un nuevo préstamo, para invertir en el negocio, comprándose ropa en distintas presentaciones y tambien comprara helados para salir a vender, esto le permitirá seguir trabajando con la ayuda de estos préstamos.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que le permitió surtir el negocio teniendo lo necesario para sus ventas, sus circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que ahora vive en una condición mejor.
texts.en:
Andrés is requesting this new loan so he can invest the money into his business. 

He is buying clothing in a variety of styles and will also buy ice cream to sell. 

The help from these loans will allow him to continue working. 

The previous loan allowed him to stock up on necessary things for his business. 

His family's conditions have improved since they now live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy clothing and ice cream.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, a 33-year-old mother of three children, lives in the company of her children and husband in the town of Msambweni. Three years ago, she decided to open a small business selling kerosene from her home.

Now requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy more gallons of kerosene to resell, her goal is to open a retail shop in her home. Fatuma states that she’s very satisfied with the financial support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to buy gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 32 years old, married, and has one child. He has been baking for six years, and he is a very hard-working man. He also relies on his wife for financial support. Faulu Kenya has helped him grow and increase his profits. 

He wishes to expand his business and also increase his profits. He requests a loan of 60,000 KES to buy wheat flour and pay his workers.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and pay his workers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther operates a retail shop at the market to earn her living. She has been engaged in her business for the last 10 years and works seven days a week. She lives with her husband and their seven children in Kampala, Uganda, and all her children are enrolled in school. She also takes care of her mother. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. The family lives in a rented house and has access to electricity; however, they do not have access to piped water. Esther's primary monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Esther has requested a loan of in the amount of 3000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT - SACCO, which she will use to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, snacks, and soft drinks to offer for sale. 

Her goals and aspirations are to ensure the education of her children up  to university level and to expand her grocery into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, snacks, and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 58 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Catarman, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last five years by selling home use products. She makes PHP 5,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 20 years old and presently lives with her family. She is a very enterprising woman who has always given her all to provide the best for her family. She is very well known among her neighbors as an example in her home, since she is a hard-working, responsible, and efficient young woman with two young children to take care of

For some time how, Loice has had a small store where she sells articles of primary necessity. Due to her nature and manner of being, she possesses her clientele, in part, because she keeps her prices affordable. She wishes to increase her earnings but lacks sufficient capital to carry out her dream.

That's why Loice approached Yehu to request a loan and thus, continue supplying her store, purchasing merchandise such as flour, milk, beans, sugar, and instant products. She hopes she can count on the help she needs and be able to continue being an exemplary woman in her home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as flour, milk, beans, sugar, and instant products.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia, a very hardworking 31-year-old married mother of one, has owned and operated a retail shop for five years; she also earns an income from farming. Now requesting a loan of 21,363.75 KES to increase her stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour, Theresia hopes to grow her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Magaly Esmeraly

texts.es:
Magaly, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita dinero para invertir en la granja de pollos, adquiriendo pollos pequeños y concentrado para engordarlos, este financiamiento le ayudara para mejorar su condición en la venta de pollos.
Considera que con el préstamo anterior sus ingresos han mejorado, logro fortalecer el negocio, gracias a la inversión que realizo con el préstamo Kiva.
texts.en:
Magaly has decided to request a new loan because she needs money to invest in her chicken farm. She wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed to fatten the chicks. This finance will help improve her opportunities to sell her chickens.

She considers that her income has improved with the last loan, and she strengthened the business thanks to the investment she made with the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tires for her husband's transport vehicle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 44 years old, married and has three children. He has been selling clothes for five years. He also earns an income from selling maize. He is very hardworking and he has managed to expand his business since he became a client of Faulu Kenya. He hopes to own a boutique and have a stable business. He needs a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 57 years old, married and has seven children. She owns a hotel (restaurant) and has been in business for six years. She is a very hardworking woman as she has to provide quality services to her customers. She also earns an income through farming where she raises cattle.

She wishes to expand her business and have more clients. She needs a loan of 106,600 KES to purchase food items and a cooking stove.

loans.use: to purchase food items and a cooking stove

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, age 41, earns her living by running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products to members of the local community. Irene has been in her business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. She lives with her husband and their two children in Poblacion, Plaridel.

Irene is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Irene joined GDMPC earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her family's living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Patman

texts.en:
Patman, age 37, is a dairy farmer. She lives in Chiatura District with her mother. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start up a family business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the dairy business. They have have three milk cows. Patman milks the cows, produces cheese, and sells it locally at the open market at a good price. Her mother is provided with a pension that brings them 125 Laris per month, which is not enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Patman has requested a loan from Credo in order to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credit with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Patman will begin trading on clothing. She plans to purchase clothing in Turkey from wholesalers and sell these items among the villagers as well as in the nearby villages. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She used her previous loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice and soda to sell. Her business did well, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She needs a second loan to increase her stock of sugar, rice, flour and cigarettes. She requires a loan of 30,000 KES. 

She hopes one day to operate a wholesale shop and be a main supplier to other shops.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and cigarettes to resell in her store.

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 11:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,al socia preprara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,caldos entre otros platos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita le credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia continues working in her restaurant business.  She makes lunch and dinner, working from 11 a.m. until 9 p.m.  She makes baked chicken, soup, and various other dishes.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant.

She's requesting the loan to buy rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, and other products to cook.

She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, and other products to cook

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, el cual utilizara en expandir mas el negocio, ya que ha agregado mas mercadería y esta en un puesto fijo, se comprara sandalias, accesorios de belleza y tambien materiales para elaborar pupusas (aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharron).
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la venta y su inventario en la venta de verduras y frutas, ella ha mejorado su comercio, las condiciones del hogar, ya que posee mejores ganancias para invertir en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen has decided to take out a new loan which she will use to further expand her business.  She has added more merchandise to her business and now has a fixed sales location.  She will buy sandals and beauty products.  She will also buy ingredients for making pupusas: oil, seasonings, 'quesillo' (soft cheese) and 'chicharrón' (shredded pork).

With her previous loan, Carmen managed to improve her sales and increase the stock of her fruit and veg business.  She has improved her business and also her living conditions as she has more profits to invest in her home.

loans.use: to buy sandals and beauty products as well as soft cheese and seasonings

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
This is Vicenta, 36, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a businessman. Vicenta is also a mother to her children. Together with her husband, Vicenta manages their household while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vicenta operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also sells RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy larger quantities of ingredients, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and other products she uses in her prepared foods business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Vicenta hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good life to her children, by the grace of God. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and products she uses to prepare meals for sale.

loans.name: Phoy's Group

texts.en:
