Phoy lives in a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, in Cambodia. She has five children, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. She earns a living through farming rice in the local area. The current business earns the family about US $5, per day, to support their family. 

Phoy is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR160,000 each. Phoy, the leader, is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials for building a proper latrine, including a latrine bowl and tile draining. Phoy hopes this loan will enable her to have a healthy latrine for her family's use, so as to create a hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel runs a food store business in Juba. He is a previous borrower with Finance Sudan and cites his achievements resulting from his previous loan as follows: he has increased his business stock and has managed to send two of his children to school. 

He is now requesting 5,000 SSP in order to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, and washing soap to offer for sale. 

He is pleased to have been given access to loans and is grateful to his lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil and washing soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 39 años, convive con Edgar, con quien tiene 5 hijos de 9, 8, 5, 4 y 2 años de edad. Todos ellos habitan una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Hermelinda trabaja con ahínco. Hace 20 años que empezó a trabajar en el campo. En este largo tiempo adquirió 12 parcelas de terrenos distribuidas en distintas partes de su localidad. En ellas produce cítricos como naranjas y limones; además de café y achiote. Y como sus cultivos se encuentran a distancias considerables de su hogar, ella se levanta de madrugada para llegar a tiempo a sus cultivos
Ella sabe muy bien cómo debe negociar su producción. Por ejemplo cosecha café en los meses de abril, mayo y junio; cosecha achiote en octubre y noviembre; y naranjas en diciembre y noviembre. De esa manera genera ingresos para su familia en casi todo el año. 
Y como el trabajo no cesa para ella, ahora se esmera en los cuidados de su maizal que espera cosechar en febrero, para ello solicita de su apoyo para comprar bolsas abono orgánico. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo antes. “Los productores Inchatingari” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo solidario.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 39 years old and lives with her partner Edgar.  The couple have five children who are 9, 8, 5, 4 and 2 years old.  They all live together in their own home which is located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  Hermelinda works very hard.  She started working in the fields 20 years ago.  Over this long period of time, she has acquired 12 plots of land which are located in different parts of her town.  On her land she grows citrus fruits such as oranges and lemons.  She also grows coffee and annatto.  As her crops are located a fair distance from her home, she gets up very early in the morning so that she can get to them on time.

Hermelinda is very good at selling her produce.  For example, she harvests her coffee in the months of April, May and June; her annatto in October and November, and her oranges in December and November.  This allows her to make income for her family year round.  Her work is never ending and she is currently tending to her corn fields which she will harvest in February.  She is requesting your support to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

This is Hermelinda's fourth loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments as she has been in the past. “Los productores Inchatingari” is the name of her community bank and she is happy to belong to the group.

Hermelinda will use her 1,000 soles to buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 33, is a vendor of fruits and vegetables. She and her husband have four children. Wishing to provide them with the highest possible quality living conditions, she started her business herself two years ago. She is a smart businesswoman and has her own selling place in the local market. 

She now wishes to develop her business further, but her income is too small to allow her to do it. She is therefore asking for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES in order to buy a supply of fruits and vegetables for developing her business.
 
Fatuma's goal is to gain a better income, allowing her to better support her family. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Terrero Blanco De Taulabe Group

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera, reside en una comunidad urbana del municipio de Taulabe, Departamento de Comayagua.
María anteriormente se dedicaba a oficios domésticos y eventualmente a la agricultura, hace 10 años que se dedica a atender su propio negocio de producción y venta de pan de manera artesanal como semitas, quesadillas, torta de leche y rosquillas.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo grupal el cual piensa invertir en la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de pan como: harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, leña y leche al por mayor.
Este financiamiento le servirá para incrementar la producción de pan y aumentar sus ventas ya que por ser un producto de buena calidad, siempre cuenta con demanda de sus clientes.
Ella piensa a largo plazo hacer mejoras a su vivienda (Mejorar techo y piso) y de esta manera mejorar su condición de vida.
Doña María pertenece al grupo solidario Terrero blanco de Taulabe, el cual está conformado por 2 miembros: Doña María y Don Angel, ambos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la elaboración de pan y carpintería respectivamente. Los dos han sido clientes de odef por mas de ocho ciclos para mantener activos sus negocios.
El préstamo total Grupal es de 20,000 Lempiras y de manera individual 10,000 Lempiras cada uno.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and single.  She lives in an urban community in the Taulabe municipality in the Comayagua department.

María used to devote herself to the household chores and occasionally to agriculture.  Ten years ago she started her own business of making and selling handmade baked goods like semitas, quesadillas, torta de leche, and rosquillas [types of pastry and rolls].

She has currently requested a group loan, which she plans to use to buy raw materials to make bread.  She will buy things like flour, eggs, sugar, shortening, firewood, and milk wholesale.  This loan will help her to increase her bread production.  Her sales will increase because of her good quality products.  She always has customer demand.

In the long term she plans to make improvements to her house (improve the roof and floor).  This way she will improve her living conditions.

María belongs to the Terrero Blanco de Taulabe communal bank.  It is comprised of two members, María and Angel.  The both live in the same community.  María makes bread and Angel works in carpentry.  They have both been ODEF clients for over eight cycles, which they do in order to stay in business.  The group loan is for 20,000 lempiras.  Each individual will receive 10,000 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy materials like flour, eggs, sugar, shortening, firewood, and milk wholesale in order to make bread.

loans.name: Wendy De Jesus

texts.es:
Wendy, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su familia, su madre y un hijo, además de su esposo, ella administra una granja de cerdos, tiene dos años de tener el negocio, lo aprendió de su madre quien tambien se dedica al comercio de cerdos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de alimento para los cerdos (concentrado) y tambien la compra de cerdos, esto le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mejores ingresos.
Su aspiración es crecer en la granja, ofrecer una mejor condición en calidad a su familia en especial a su hijo.
texts.en:
Wendy's business is raising pigs.  She is 21 years old and lives with her family (her mother, her son and her husband).  She runs a pig farm.  She has been in the business for two years, having learned it from her mother who also sells pigs.

Wendy is requesting a loan to buy feed for her existing pigs (concentrate) and some additional pigs.  This will help her to increase her stock and make better income.

Wendy's aspiration is to grow her farming business and to offer her family a better quality of life, especially her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate (feed)

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo de 3 años, viven en casa de sus padres, su negocio es la venta de joyas y una tienda, con esto mantiene a su familia, su experiencia en el negocio es de 10 años, por iniciativa propia.
Él solicita un préstamo, con el fin de tener efectivo para la compra de oro, del cual logra pulir y elaborar anillos, esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y que sus ingresos sean mejor.
Su aspiración es a través del préstamo poder fortalecer el negocio, mejorando sus condiciones económicas con su familia.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old.  He lives with his wife and has a 3-year-old son.  They live in his parents' home.  José's business is selling jewelry and he has a store.  This is how he supports his family.  He has 10 years experience in his business which he started on his own initiative.

José is requesting a loan so that he has cash available to buy gold which he will polish and make rings with.  This investment will help him to increase his stock and his income will improve.

José's aspiration is to use his loan to strengthen his business and improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy gold for making rings

loans.name: Jasper

texts.en:
Jasper is 32 years old, married and has two children. She is from Solinog, Calamba. 

Jasper buys and sells fish to make a living. She has been doing this for six years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

Jasper is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish for resale. Jasper joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice earns an income by operating a shoe sales business. She has been in this business for four years. Previously, her sole income came from practicing farming, and she started her business in order to earn additional income. She still earns an income from farming today. She is married and has four children. 
 
Eunice's business has grown substantially since she joined Faulu Kenya, and she has increased her profits through the smart utilization of the loans she has received. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 21,363.75 in order to increase her stock of shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Dolores Senaida

texts.es:
Dolores, tiene 35 años de edad, actualmente está separada de su esposo, ella tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos quienes son los mayores, le ayudan a realizar la siembra de maíz, ya que Dolores se dedica a esta actividad, lo aprendió con sus padres.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla mejorada y preparación de tierra, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar la posibilidad de recibir una buena cosecha.
Su aspiración es fortalecer más el negocio, ayudar a su hogar, ofreciendo a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dolores is 35 years old and currently separated from her husband.  She has five children, two of whom are adults.  They help her to sow her corn.  Dolores learned this business from her parents.

Dolores is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and improved seed, and to prepare her soil.  This purchase will help her to increase her possibilities of enjoying a good harvest.

Dolores' aspiration is to further strengthen her business and to help her household, offering her children what they need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improved seed, and to prepare the soil

loans.name: Chavasinya

texts.en:
Chavasinya, age 49, is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and six children. He has been engaged in farming for the past six years, producing milk and eggs which he sells in his locality. For additional income, he is employed and is paid a small salary.
 
He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to purchase poultry birds. With the money he will receive from selling the eggs from these birds, he intends to improve his family's standard of living, pay for his children's education, and expand his dairy project so that he can start selling cows over the next five years.

An unreliable market, high costs of feed, pests, and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

Chavasinya is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for allowing him to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina de 32 años es una mujer separada. Tiene 5 hijos a los que cuida con amor, bajo un techo propio ubicado en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Justina es una mujer como pocas. Su fuerza le hizo superar la decepción que significó la separación con su pareja. Ahora ella sola se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos. Ella es agricultora, hace 10 años; actualmente cuenta con 9 lotes de terrenos de cultivos, que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. En ellos siembra café, achiote, y cítricos como naranjas y tanyelos. “cada año cosecho 1500 kilos de achiote, cada kilo lo vendo a 4 soles, si es rentable”, dice.
El trabajo es muy cansado, por eso recibe de su hijo mayor, pero cuando las jornadas son intensas recurre a contratar personal como jornaleros para las cosechas. “En mayo las ventas son buenas, porque el café alcanza el precio más alto”, menciona. Justina, a pesar de todo, está contenta con su labor, porque todo lo obtiene es producto de su esfuerzo. Ahora espera producir otra parcela de café, para ello deberá limpiar sus cultivos para plantar nuevos cafetales, ya que ya tiene los viveros listos para su plantación. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el  pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse respaldada con su banco comunal “Productores de Inchatingari”, porque sus compañeros comparten los mismos planes.
Con los 1000 soles podrá pagar a los jornaleros quienes plantarán los viveros de café. Si le sobra el dinero comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Justina is 32 years old and separated.  She has five children who she loves and cares for in her own home which is located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  Justina is a woman like few others.  It was her strength which enabled her to overcome the disappointment that she felt when she separated from her partner.  She is now solely responsible for the care of her children.  She has been farming for 10 years and currently has 9 plots of land on which she grows crops.  She received these plots of land from her community and her parents and uses them to grow coffee, annatto and citrus fruits such as oranges and tangelos.  "Every year I harvest 1,500 kilos of annatto and I sell each kilo for 4 soles.  It is profitable", she says.

Justina's work is very tiring so she receives help from her eldest son.  However, when the day's work is really strenuous she hires day laborers to help with the harvesting.  "In May sales are good because coffee reaches its highest price", she says.  In spite of everything, Justina is happy with her work because everything she obtains is the product of her own efforts.  She is currently hoping to start sowing another plot of land with coffee but she will need to weed in order to plant new coffee crops.  She has the seedlings ready for her plantation.

This is Justina's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  She says that she feels supported by her community bank 'Productores de Inchatingari' because her fellow group members all share the same plans.

Justina will use her 1,000 soles to pay the day laborers who will plant her coffee seedlings.  If she has any money left over she will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay day laborers and to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 57 years old. He is a widower and lives by himself in Telavi District.

Tengiz has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of their low income and poor living conditions. The only source of the income for Tengiz is a small monthly salary, earned by him, working as a daily worker at the fields of local farmers. He also has chronic health problems and gets a monthly pension from the local government. It totals 270 GEL per month and it is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses. According to Credo estimations, Tengiz belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tengiz requested a loan from Credo to re-start-up a family business which had been stopped recently because of financial problems. His loan request was approved in the frames of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received loan, Tengiz will purchase a horse. He will go to the local forest and use the horse to haul wood from the forest. He will sell the wood in the village and earn income. The wood is mainly used by the village population for ovens to heat the houses and cook. He will also serve local farmers and cultivate land. 

Tengiz hopes that the income will be enough for him and the new business initiative. Being financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a horse.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard, age 44, sells plastic cups, basins, buckets, and spoons to earn a living. He transports his wares via his motorcycle. He started this business three years ago, before which he earned his income through farming. He is a very hard-working man. He and his wife have two children, and the family also relies on his wife's income. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Bernard's business has grown substantially. He has been able to better support his family through his improved business.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 68,799.38 in order to buy basins, jugs, baskets, spoons, plates, and cups to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy basins, jugs, baskets, spoons, plates, and cups to offer for sale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet operates a beauty salon at her local market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years and works six days a week. Harriet and her husband live in Kampala, Uganda, and have one child. She also takes care of her sister. The family currently lives in a rented house and has access to electricity but not to piped water. Harriet's primary monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Harriet has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO in order to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves, and hairsprays. Her major business challenges are defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully-stocked salon and eventually to build a house.

loans.use: to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves, and hairsprays

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy six bags of manure.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver operates a retail shop located in Blessed Comboni Secondary School. She also earns an additional income as a teacher. She lives with her husband and their four children in Masindi, Uganda.

Oliver's dream is to secure the education of her children. Inadequate capital is her biggest challenge. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy general merchandise to offer for sale in her shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda, age 44, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

Berlinda lives in Bacoor, Cavite, with her husband Gaspar and their children. She and Gaspar manage their household while operating the business. Berlinda works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages with which to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Berlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams of offering her children a good, high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members where she shares stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and household products to offer for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with six children, two of whom are in school, and also takes care of her grandmother.  She works seven days a week selling green bananas from home and has been in this business for the last 10 years.  

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, and cassava.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van to ease transportation and to buy a plot of land to build a house.  She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, sweet potatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann, age 28, is a fish vendor. She lives in Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, with her husband and their four children. Her husband is a fisherman, and Joann sells the fish he catches. She has operated her business for six years and earns PhP 3,000 a month. 

Joann joined GDMPC earlier this year. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000, which will be used to repair the fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Guya Ezekiel

texts.en:
Guya, a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba, is married and has three children between the ages of three and ten, all of whom go to school. Guya, who runs a general store, has been in business for three years. His major challenges include high market prices.

Having learned about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers, he has requested a loan of 5000sdg to purchase more batteries, radios, etc. Within five years he would like to expand his business and open other branches. Guya says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as radios, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Hishigjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Hishigjargal, age 32 and widowed, makes and sells boots to earn a living. She lives with her three children in their small house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She is a modest and hard-working woman who reports that she wants her children to be fully educated. Two of her children go to secondary school, but one of her sons has been sick for long time and now stays at home permanently under his mother's care. 

Mrs. Hishigjargal has been working for a boot manufacturer for several years, but she now needs to stay home to take care of her sick child. For this reason, she is planning to start her own business of manufacturing boots in her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 MNT in order to purchase required inventory items and an electric machine for her newly-starting business.

loans.use: to purchase required inventory items and an electric machine for her new boot manufacturing business

loans.name: Medi Flavia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de panaderia,ella sigue alquilando un horno y prepara diferentes tipos de panes y luego lo vende en la plaza de armas o mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de panderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar pan como manteca,azucar y harinas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is still running her bakery and still renting the oven to make a variety of breads which she then sells in the main square and at markets. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., and has been running her business for 7 years. Her business is doing well. Her dream is to expand her bakery. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as butter, sugar, and flour to make bread.
She is happy with the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as butter, sugar, and flour to make bread for her bakery.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
For over two years in Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Juvelyn, a 25-year-old married mother of two children, has made a living through the operation of a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Recently, Juvelyn joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is a 57-year-old farmer in Kitale County in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children. Only two are still schooling. He has been in farming for the past fifty years and produces milk, poultry and horticultural crops, which he sells at the local market.

He is requesting a 31,200 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, from which he will sell the milk. He will use the money to uplift his family's living standards and educate his children. He plans to expand his dairy project and redouble his production in the next five years.

Unreliable rainfall, the high cost of production and inadequate capital are his major challenges in farming.

He is grateful for Juhudi Kilimo for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena de 37 años convive con Michael, con quien tiene 3 hijos pero solo vive con 1 de ellos, en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Elena es una mujer persistente. Se dedica a la agricultura al lado de su pareja. “Desde los 17 años ya trabajo en el campo y me gusta mi trabajo”, menciona. En sus 3 parcelas de terrenos produce café, kión, frutos cítricos como naranjas y mandarinas, además de fréjoles. Las cosechas de café y kión son una vez al año y para ella es beneficioso, porque obtiene una buena ganancia que le ayuda a solventar sus gastos, ahorrar y volver a invertir. Pero como los frutos cítricos y los fréjoles obtiene para cubrir sus gastos básicos y diarios.
De esa manera trabaja Elena, y le agrada laborar en el aire abierto de sus montes. Esta vez se encargará de fertilizar dichos cultivos y limpiarlos de la mala yerba, para ello requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP. Esta vez también menciona que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y se siente a gusto trabajando con socios responsables.
Invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café, kión y frutos cítricos.
texts.en:
Elena, 37, lives with Michael, with whom she has three children.  She lives with only one of them, in their own house in a native community in the central jungle.

Elena's a persistent woman who makes a living in agriculture alongside her partner.  "Since I was 17 I've worked in the fields and I like my job," she says.  On her three plots of land she produces coffee, ginger, citrus fruits such as oranges and tangerines, and beans.  The coffee and ginger harvests are once a year, and they're profitable for her because she makes a good profit, which helps her cover her expenses, save, and invest again.  She gets enough from the citrus fruits and beans to cover her basic and daily expenses.  This is how Elena works, and she likes to work outside in her hills.

This time she's going to fertilize and weed the crops, for which she needs your help.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She also mentions that this time she'll make the monthly payments punctually.  She belongs to Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi Communal Bank, and she's comfortable working with responsible members.

She'll invest the 1500 soles [PEN] in bags of organic fertilizer to spread on her coffee, ginger, and citrus crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Santos Salvador

texts.es:
Santos, tiene 45 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos quienes estudian actualmente, él es agricultor, dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos y tambien a la ganadería,  este lo aprendió con sus padres y tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra se semilla, abono, preparación  de la tierra, esto le permitirá realizar una buena siembra, que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
Su aspiración es crecer sus cultivos y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school.  He is a farmer who grows basic grains and also raises cattle.  He learned this business from his parents and has been working in it for more than 20 years.  

Santos is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to prepare the soil.  This will allow him to sow his plants well and he will improve his income.

Santos' aspiration is to grow his crops and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to prepare the soil

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, 47 years old, is married and has 6 children. She is from Lusot, Baliangao. For the past 5 years, Lorna has been growing coconuts and bananas to sell, earning 6,000 PHP a month. Lorna is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Lorna joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.en:
A perfect sewer from Tajikistan needs your help and support. Gulnigor, 31 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. The fast development of the modern world makes their children more progressive, so they must comfort them with all modern conveniences.

Four years ago, Gulnigor began her own business, sewing national women's dresses, in order to provide her children with a better quality of life. She operates her business from her house. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since Gulnigor has had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan to buy the machine and she promises to make her payments on time. Gulnigor awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jesusa hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is a 32-year-old, single man who lives alone in his own wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His home is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Since 2009, he has been working as a signal-security engineer in a private company. As a young single man, he works hard and because of his workload he usually goes to work in the early morning and comes home late at night. In summertime, he directly goes to bed/sleep if he comes in late, but in winter he needs to set fire to warm the house. Setting fire takes time. He needs to prepare firewood and sometimes he has a day without firewood due to a full schedule on the job. So Myagmarsuren is planning to change his coal-burning furnace with an electrical heating one in order to cut the usage of coal that generates harmful chemicals to the atmosphere and to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to change his coal-burning furnace with an electrical heating unit in order to cut the usage of coal

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rica would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients such as fruits, pork and other street foods needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs. Rica looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rica dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is an ambitious man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a widow charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child. Peter is a teacher by profession but also operates a retail shop to supplement his meager salary. His business is located on a busy highway, thereby attracting a number of revelers who make it a point to stop over and buy from him due to his customer care. Peter's greatest challenge is inadequate capital. His dreams are to educate his child and to own a wholesale shop. Peter is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as salt and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Hilton

texts.en:
Hilton, a 32-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda, works on his farm eight hours a day. Like most farmers in Uganda, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation.

Hilton is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and manure. His vision is to venture into mechanized agriculture so as to increase his output, while his personal goal is to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and manure.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 31-year-old, married man with two children, ages 4 and 3, living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture, he started a produce business 3 years ago. With the income earned, Richard has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business and also has continued to do farming. He dreams of building a big residential house for his growing family and owning a food store that can sustainably supply the region despite challenges of unpredictable weather and bad roads that affect his business. Richard intends to use the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, age 38 years, is a single woman with five children, ages 1 to 14 years; 3 of which are in school. Jane owns a retail shop in the town of Kagadi, Uganda that she started from savings from a video hall she owns. She describes herself as hardworking and has a dream to have a wholesale shop in the future and to educate all her children to university level. Jane wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and general merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and general merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is from Poblacion, Plaridel. She is 43 years old. Loreta is married and has 5 children. To make a living, she makes and sells food or some snack foods. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. This year, she joined GDMPC. Loreta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 43-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. He is a father to 5 children, is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Charles was inspired to the teaching profession by his urge to serve the nation and he feels there was no better way but to teach the children of his nation. He does farming to supplement the low pay from his salary. Charles wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en: Willy is a 34-year-old man, married with two children. A teacher who was inspired into that profession by the urge to serve his nation, Willy feels there was no better way but to teach the children of his nation. He also does farming from which he earns to supplement his low salary. Willy wants to educate his children to university level and do commercial agriculture. He wants a loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.en:
Maria Tereza is a single mother of three children aged between 7 and 16 years. She deals in a local brew commonly known as Waragi.
A resident of Kagadi, Uganda, Maria Tereza has been in this business for 10 years and she supplements it with farming. As a single mother she plans to invest in real estate to secure her children’s future.
Weather and bad roads are major challenges to her business. Maria Tereza wants a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy more local brew for resale.

loans.name: Merline

texts.en:
Merline is a 33-year-old nipa shingle maker/weaver from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the "nipa" native palm-weaving business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Merline is asking for a loan to buy more nipa to weave and sell. With this, she will be be able to weave in bulk and sell her product to the market, thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy more nipa (palm) to weave and sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more fish to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 12,000 PHP, to buy more fish of different kinds needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gina hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with the other members of her fellowship* to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, being a 39-year-old businessman, expresses his achievement in the first loan as follows: He has increased his stock, paid part of his children's school fees and is taking 4,000 SDG to continue running his business and he is happy for FSL support.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
This is Hazel. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of products like choppers, wonder mops, slicers, cutters, sponges and juicers. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. Hazel looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hazel dreams of becoming successful in her business. A harmonious relationship with her husband and a good education for their child is her dream for her family. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of products she needs in her business.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik lives in Akhalkalaki District. He is 32 years old, married and lives with his wife Alina and 2-year-old son. Alina is a housewife. Edik is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source for the family is agricultural land, where they grow potatoes and sell seasonally. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the vulnerable poor category. 

Edik decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Edik will purchase a car and serve to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Joseph Michael

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 10, all of them attending school. For the past 3 years, Joseph has operated a general store on his own. He has no other source of income. Joseph heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking out a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase more items such as body lotions, Pampers, etc.

In 5 years, Joseph would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenge is high market prices. Joseph says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as body lotions, Pampers, etc.

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.en:
Ziyoda is a hard working woman. She is married and has three children. Their ages are 25, 19 and 17 years old. 
In order to generate  a good living condition for her family, Ziyoda has been busy with making wood dishes for more than 26 years. She sells her products at the local market and has many customers. 
Through financial support from her parents, Ziyoda has managed to grow her business. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan to of 2,000 TJS (Tajikistan somoni) to buy wood.  She will look for your help.

loans.use: To buy wood  to make dishes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 30 year old man, married, with a 4 month old child. He is a teacher who was inspired into that profession by the urge to earn a living. Patrick also has a poultry farm from which he supplements his low salary. 
Patrick lives in the town of Kagadi, Uganda and dreams of educating himself in the future. He wants a loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja en su hogar, tiene un taller de estructuras metalicas, este taller lo inicio por ideas propias, lo tiene en su casa, no hay un horario establecido para atenderlo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hierro, pintura, electrodos, que son parte importante para aplicarlos al taller y realizar su trabajo diario.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio mas amplio, con mas capacidad, además quiere tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elías lives with his wife and two children. He is the only one working in his household. He has a metal structure workshop, which he started from his own initiative. His workshop is located in his own house and does not work on a set schedule. 
He is requesting a loan to purchase iron, paint and electrodes, inputs which are an important part of his workshop and which he uses on a daily basis. His dream is to be able to have a larger business, with a greater capacity. He also dreams of owning his own house.

loans.use: To purchase iron, paint and electrodes.

loans.name: Marybeth

texts.en:
This is Marybeth, she previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of men's and women's clothing needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for buying more stock of men's and women's clothes. She also has a variety store. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marybeth hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Santos Mario

texts.es:
El Señor Santos tiene 52 años de edad, es soltero,  reside en compañía de su madre y su hermana  en  el municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Santos anteriormente trabajaba en una panadería y vendía verduras,  hace 3  años que estableció un negocio de venta de teléfonos celulares, baterías y accesorios.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de más teléfono celulares, baterías, memorias y cargadores.
Agradece a ODEF y KIVA por el apoyo financiero brindado, él espera aumentar sus ingresos para en el futuro hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y lograr superar su condición de vida
texts.en: Santos, 52, is single living with his mother and sister in San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  He used to work in a bakery and sold vegetables but three years ago started a business selling mobile phones, batteries and accessories.  He’s currently asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy more mobile phones, batteries, memories and chargers.  He thanks ODEF and KIVA for the financing provided.  He hopes to increase his income so that he can make some home improvements and attain better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, batteries and accessories.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de panes,ella los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los panes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harin,azucar y mantequilla para preparar panes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues with her business, baking and selling bread. She sells the bread at different markets, working from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has been working in this business for 7 years and her business is doing well. She supports her children through this business. Her dream is to have premises to sell her bread from. 

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, and butter to make bread. She is happy with the loan and pledges to meet her repayments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and butter to make bread to sell.

loans.name: Gustavo Enrique

texts.es:
El Señor Gustavo tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 3 hijos. Reside en compañía  de sus hijos  en  una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Gustavo trabajaba como operario en una fabrica maquiladora pero fue cesanteado por cierre de operaciones de la empresa. Hace 2 años estableció su taller de tapicería donde fabrica muebles, repara camas, colchones y también hace tallados en madera.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de madera y telas para finalizar  un pedido de muebles  de sus clientes.
Gustavo tiene como meta aumentar las ventas para invertir sus ganancias en la educación de sus hijos. El es muy conocido en su comunidad como una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en: Gustavo, 45, is single and has three children.  He lives with them in a community in San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  Gustavo used to be employed at an assembly plant but was let go when the firm ceased operation.  Two years ago he opened his upholstery shop where he makes furniture, repairs beds, mattresses and also does wood carving.  He’s currently asking for a 5,000 Lempira loan he plans to use to buy wood and fabric to finish a customer furniture order.  Gustavo’s goal is to increase sales to invest his profits in his children’s education.  He’s very well-known in the community as a responsible, hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy wood and fabric to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, sausages, dairy products, soft drinks, and more in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: La señora Santos tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. hace 8 años que ella estableció su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de consumo diario como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, huevos, harina, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, pelotas de plástico, condimentos, churros, dulces, pan, bananos y otros productos de abarrotería. Ella ha sido cliente de ODEF por 6 ciclos de préstamos para mantener activo su negocio. El préstamo que ha solicitado actualmente es por 16,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir mas el negocio de granos básicos, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, churros, manteca, azúcar, harina etc. con su negocio surtido podrá dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Tiene como meta hacer crecer más el negocio y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Santos, 34, lives with her husband and son in a village in Esparta, Atlántida.  She opened her own grocery store 8 years ago to sell daily consumption items like basic grains, sugar, lard, eggs, flour, canned goods, cleaning supplies, plastic balls, condiments, snacks, candy, bread, plantain and other groceries.  She’s been an ODEF client for six loan cycles to stay in business.  The loan she’s requested now is for 16,000 Lempiras and she’ll use it to stock her store with more basic grains, canned gods, cleaning supplies, snacks, lard, sugar, flour, etc.  With a well-stocked store she’ll be able to provide better customer service.   Her goal is to make the business grow more and to earn good profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Carlota Irma

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de panaderia,ella elabora panes y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de panderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mentequilla,harina,azucar y manteca.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: The borrower continues working in her bakery, making bread and then selling it on the streets. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and has been running her business for 7 years. Her dream is to expand her bakery. She is requesting this loan to buy butter, flour, sugar, and shortening. The borrower is very grateful for the loan and committed to making the repayments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour, and sugar to make bread.

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en:
Umriniso is a perfect business woman. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She has had her own business for twelve years, and it is her source of income. She sells fruits and vegetables. 

She has had not many customers for a time and that’s why she decided to widen the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni. With the loan, she is going to buy more fruits and vegetables, as she wishes to satisfy the demand from her customers and always keep her store well-stocked. 

Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for widening the assortment of her goods.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 42 años convive con Ricardo con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero vive con 4 de ellos de: 16, 13, 12 y 10. Ellos habitan una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Vilma es una mujer organizada. Gracias a su desempeño y fuerza de voluntad puede mantener a su numerosa familia. Se dedica a la agricultura hace 25 años, actualmente cuenta con 5 lotes de terrenos de cultivos, que su comunidad le otorgó desde que unió su vida a su esposo. En ellos siembra café, achiote, plátanos y un poco de cítricos como naranjas y tangeellos (cítrico híbrido).
El trabajo es muy cansado, por eso recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero cuando las jornadas son intensas recurre a contratar personal como jornaleros para las cosechas y siembra de café.
“Esta vez he plantado plátano, pero esperaré 1 año para que dé los primero frutos”, dice. Vilma solicita de su apoyo para asegurar un crecimiento sano de su platanal. Requiere adquirir bolsas de abonos. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Comenta que, el trabajo en equipo es más satisfactorio, así que le agrada pertenecer a su banco comunal llamado “Los productores Inchatingari”. Menciona que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Con los 1000 soles, Vilma podrá fertilizar sus pequeñas platas de plátano. Comprará 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 42, lives with Ricardo with whom she has six children but only four of them still live with them; they are 16, 13, 12 and 10 years of age.  They live in her own house in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  Vilma’s a very organized woman.  Thanks to her effort and force of will she’s able to support her large family.  She’s been working in agriculture for 25 years and currently has five parcels of land under cultivation that her community granted her since she joined her life to her husband’s.  They grow coffee, annatto, bananas and some citrus fruit like oranges and tangelos (hybrid citrus).  It’s very demanding work so she gets help from her children but when the work load is intense she has to hire personnel like day laborers for harvesting and planting coffee.

“This time around I planted bananas and must wait a year for the first fruits,” she says.  Vilma is asking for your support to insure the healthy growth of her banana plants.  She needs to buy bags of manure.  This is her 4th MFP loan.  She comments that teamwork is more satisfying so she enjoys being part of her communal bank called “Los Productores Inchatingari.”  She mentions that she’ll make her payments punctually.  Vilma will use the 1000 soles to fertilize her young banana plants.  She will buy ten bags of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 41 años es viudo. Tiene 6 hijos de 18, 15, 12, 10, 9 y 8. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Oscar es alegre y responsable. Desde que falleció su esposa tuvo que dedicarse a sus hijos en la alimentación y educación. 
Es por eso que Oscar se esfuerza mucho en el trabajo del campo para mantener a su numerosa familia. Cuenta con 7 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en ellos siembra café, achiote y cítricos como naranjas y limones.
Ahora tiene un lote entero de café renovado, es decir recién plantado. Éste cafetal tendrá que esperar 3 años como mínimo para ofrecer sus primeros granos. Oscar cuidará de estas plantas con paciencia y dedicación.
Este mes tiene sembrados frijoles, y un poco de maíz, los que cosechará el próximo año. Por eso requiere de apoyo para adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para dichos productos. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además afirma sentirse cómodo en su banco comunal “Productores de Inchatingari”, por que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y responsables.
Con los 1500 soles solicitados podrá adquirir 10 bolsas de abono orgánico y podrá pagar a los jornaleros quienes le apoyarán en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Oscar, 41, is a widower.  He has six children aged 18, 15, 12, 10, 9 and 8.  They live in their own home, located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  Oscar is cheerful and responsible.  Ever since his wife died, he's devoted himself to the feeding and education of their children.

This is the reason that Oscar works very hard in the fields, so that he can support his large family.  He has 7 parcels of land where he grows coffee, achiote, and citrus such as oranges and limes. 

Now he has a whole lot that he has recently renewed, or re-planted, with coffee.  He will have to wait at least 3 years until this coffee plantation offers up its first beans.  Oscar will care for these plants with patience and dedication.

This month, he has to plant some beans and a bit of corn, which he will be able to harvest next year.  To do this, he needs support so that he can acquire sacks of organic fertilizer for these crops.  This is his 4th loan with MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time.  Also, he says that he feels very comfortable in his communal bank Productores de Inchatingari,” because the members are supportive and responsible.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles he requests, he will be able to buy 10 sacks of organic fertilizer, and he will also be able to pay farmhands to help him with this activity.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 27-years-old, has been practicing mixed farming for over five years in Nkubu county, Kenya. His farm produces maize, peas and milk, all of which he sells locally at the market in his area. High cost of feed is his major challenge.

George is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry to raise. This will improve his standard of living as he plans to start a family in the future. He also aspires to increase his farm by half an acre within the next five years.

George is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving him loan opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina says that she benefited a lot from the previous loan as follows: She has increased her stock and finished paying for her child’s schooling. 

She is taking another loan to continue with her business, and she is happy for FSL loans.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.
